Author: Rickting
Review_Title: The first awesome Spider-Man film for 13 years
Review: Tom Holland Is Spider-Man. We'll always have Tobey Maguire, but Tom Holland has the charm, the humour, the emotional depth and first and foremost, he looks and acts like a kid. So, armed with the best Spider-Man portrayal to date, the MCU brings Spider-Man swinging into cinemas- for the third time in 15 years. Rest assured; this is a good film. This is a review coming from someone who's grown pretty fed up with the MCU lately. The key thing about Spider-Man Homecoming is that it's fun. It's a witty, funny high-school movie that happens to be full of superheroes. It's also uneven, features a somewhat dull would-be love interest (Though thankfully nothing as annoying as Kirsten Dunst's Mary Jane Watson- this movie's MJ is very interesting) and has a far more workman-like director than Sam Raimi or Marc Webb at the helm, but those issues don't hold the movie back. Fun action, a fast, charming, witty and ultra-cool screenplay and all-around strong performances make this a very good time at the movies, and the decision to show Spidey's emotional turmoil and coming of age instead of his origins was a masterstroke. This suggests a bright future for Spider-Man in the MCU- and it has one of the best, if not The best, MCU post-credits scenes ever.

Author: ugesh-54950
Review_Title: Homecoming of the SpiderMan franchise into our hearts.
Review: This Movie was really good. I really lost the trust in the franchise as it was rebooted so quickly two times and was pleasantly surprised . Tom Holland killed it as Peter Parker. I thought this movie would outshine with Iron Man and to my surprise it had just the amount of Robert Downey Jr in it. Also I was getting worried through the course of the film that Peter is so dependent on the suit Tony gave it to him and I felt really redeemed when Tony took away the suit and Peter was back to square one and he fought the Vulture all by his own with his DIY suit that was a great moment in the film.

Author: ossie85
Review: Spider-Man: Homecoming is undoubtedly one of the best Spider-Man films yet. This movie has it all - a great cast, an authentic John Hughes feel, and a freshness that captures the essence of Spider-Man.

Author: davidburduli
Review: It was not movie, It was some kind of cartoon. Even Spider-man cartoons are better then this trash. It totally ruined my childhood spider-man and made me totally disappointed. I think previous versions of Spider-man were 100% better than this and one of them had to be continued.

Author: yannigk
Review: I think I might've put my expectations a bit too high, the film feels a bit standard for marvel. It is up to par with Dr. Strange, for example, but not as memorable as.. er.. I guess Marvel's standards are pretty high. This one feels more down to earth. Spiderman fights his villains on his own, and so isn't bogged down by the large scale and heaviness of films like the Avengers. I particularly liked the opening scene with Peter Parker making a little video diary, with some scenes from Civil War in it. Totally what a 15 yo teenager would do.

Author: jdejesus7645
Review_Title: Just to juvenile, way too much talking.
Review:
Cool CGI, but this completely changes everything about Spider-Man. I found it very annoying. Great to use as a "Shut Up" movie for little kids on a long road trip.
Sorry To Stan Lee, they ruined your character.

Author: TheMovieDoctorful
Review_Title: A Soulless, Hollow, Stakeless Toy Commercial, The Worst Spider-Man Film Ever
Review: With the recent release of Into the Spider-Verse, I couldn't think of a better time to vent my feelings about this terrible, terrible superhero film. Spider-Man: Homecoming is horrendous. It's a disgrace, It's an insult to everything that made me fall in love with the character of Spider-Man. Calling it a "movie" would be generous; it's a soulless product designed to sell Spider-Man toys and hype up future films. It is Marvel's Batman & Robin; a pandering toy commercial without the slightest semblance of a heart or genuine creative vision.

Author: dafalias
Review: What was that??

Author: OnlyTheFinest
Review_Title: What happens in this movie again?
Review: After watching this movie once I have no intention of watching it again. There were many parts in the movie that had me bored, Spiderman's showdown with the villain wasn't memorable at all..i don't remember how he was defeated or what even happens during the fight. Definitely an over-rated Spiderman movie.

Author: andrewmckenley
Review: I grew up on Spider-Man in the 90's and this movie and it's storyline simply don't add up.

Author: EthanBJones_03
Review_Title: There is no such thing as a perfect Spider-Man movie... but this is the closest we've got
Review: ​'SPIDER-MAN: HOMECOMING' was directed by Jon Watts and stars Tom Holland, Michael Keaton and Jacob Batalon.​Thrilled by his experience with the Avengers, young Peter Parker returns home to live with his Aunt May. Under the watchful eye of mentor Tony Stark, Parker starts to embrace his newfound identity as Spider-Man. He also tries to return to his normal daily routine -- distracted by thoughts of proving himself to be more than just a friendly neighbourhood superhero. Peter must soon put his powers to the test when the evil Vulture emerges to threaten everything that he holds dear.

Author: d-00278
Review: "Spider-Man Homecoming" is the sweetest superhero movie I've even seen. Tom Holland who plays the Spider Man looks so adorable and young that he freshens the superhero movie. Most of his troubles are little stuff only met by teens like wanting to impress the girl he has crush on and showing off his superhero identity. The villain is n't like those confronted by Spide Man and he is also a victim (His job was taken away by Stark Industries) and what he's done is just for his family, which really moves me. I really like the cool girl who seems never give a damn about anything and often makes fun of other losers including Peter Park and kinda steals Peter's thunder. Can't wait to see the next Spider Man movie!

Author: acastillo26
Review_Title: Tom is great! Store you ehh...
Review: Tom has so much potential, have to give him a chance and less dependence in other actors, he's the guy great cast now trust him instead of depending on other actors to help him. He's great.

Author: MeBeiM
Review_Title: A little bit exaggerated, to say the least
Review: I'll just start by saying I've never been a great fan of superhero movies, but I do actually like Spiderman.

Author: caitlinthompson-03016
Review_Title: Never Judge a Movie By the First 10 Minutes
Review: I almost stopped watching this after the first 10 minutes. I thought where the hell did they dig this actor up? Immature, silly and just plain annoying, I did decide to keep going and see what would transpire.

Author: DanielHibbert51
Review: Spider-Man home coming is the first movie that I have watched in the new series of Spider-Man Films, going into this movie I did have my doubts as I have been used to the original movies.

Author: Puroo
Review: I hadn't watched any MCU movies until the release of Avengers: Infinity War. Everyone was talking about it and I had just joined college. So I decided to bingewatch all the MCU movies so that I could catch up before AvengersL Endgame releases. As I was watching all the movies I was getting really impatient to watch Spider-Man: Homecoming. The reason is pretty obvious: It's Spider-Man, literally the only superhero I actually cared about before watching MCU. Sure Iron Man came a close second, but I wouldnt' know anything about Iron Man if not for MCU. Spider-Man, however, I was a fan of him since childhood. I had watched the Sam Raimi trilogy, I had played that 2000 game, I had his toys and I had seen his cartoons. So Spider-Man is the only MCU hero who is so close to my heart. And here he has been given a very faithful adaptation.

Author: michal-levandowski
Review: The only reason why I don't feel I lost my evening was that I met my friends. The actor playing leading role was bad, the screenplay was awful! And what Marisa Tomei was doing there! And Gwyneth at the end 1 minute? come on...you can do better than that. Spiderman should be dead after all these injuries-It's just wrong written, all these co-incidents- bad bad bad-not worth going to cinema. Completely heartless.

Author: ilcool90
Review_Title: As annoying as the last reboot
Review: This technically a 4th reboot of Spider-man ( if you count the one from the 70s ).

Author: x_manicure_x
Review: I have never been a fan of Spider-Man in any of his incarnations, and I pretty much hated him in Captain America: Civil War. I know he is supposed to be annoying, but so many gags that are supposed to be fun mostly end up being overly cringeworthy (unless you are in third grade or something). The movie itself is fairly enjoyable despite the plot being so simplistic: the first half is a bit bland and the facts are mostly uninteresting, but it grows on you towards the end. It gets interesting from Homecoming day, which is also when we start getting some proper action and a clear direction in the events. Vulture was the biggest surprise as he is one of the best MCU villains. He is far from being the best movie villain ever and lacked real motivation, but at least he got some personality. Anyway a pleasant movie perfect for summertime.

Author: siderite
Review_Title: Better, but way over the top
Review: This Spider-Man doesn't suck and it was enough for everybody to praise the film. But I say it is not enough. The greed that made the cinematic universe to even exist and mix everything up together is also responsible for the way this movie went over any limit where it is simply fun.

Author: movie_goer82
Review_Title: Grow up Marvel. Don't destroy the favorite Comic Characters.
Review: It has become a trend to give high ratings to a movie coming out from Marvel. Watched the movie yesterday after so much hype and amazing ratings on IMDb. But alas, the movie totally ruined my experience. The world we are living in follows the herd mentality and moves as guided by propaganda. Sam Raimi's version of Spider-man was way better than this crap.

Author: D4V1D2411
Review_Title: A kinda good spider-man for the MCU
Review: I have a lot of mix feelings with this spider-man. On one side I love that now he can interact with the Avengers and that he is part of this universe, I like that he is still a teenager and I really lve that he doesnt know how to do the job yet, he is still learning how to do things and how not to screw up. But on the other side, I feel that he is carried a lot by Iron Man, giving him a suit with a lot of functions, that the goal of peter is to impress Tony, instead of wanting to help all the people he can, I absolutely ate his side characters, because while they can be funny at times, when rewatching the movie, the jokes arent as good as the first time and they dont contribute to anything else. But now, on the god things, the villain is pretty good, he is intimidating and has very good motivations. Still, despite all the personal problems I have with this interpretation of Spider-man, I still enjoy a lot this movie because it has really cool moments and the story is very good, and it still isnt my least favourite spider-man.

Author: alexscott-35299
Review: Tom Holland is easily the best Spider-Man and this movie is absolutely perfect. It gets the tone just right and it just feels like a teen comedy featuring Spider-Man and I love it. The story is great and it's not a typical Spider-Man origin story for once and I'm so glad as that whole story has been rehashed too many times over the past 20 years, the way they went with the story worked so well and it was so cool to finally see Peter as a teenager and acting like a teenager. The villain is portrayed so well, Micheal Keaton is amazing and I'm so glad he has finally appeared in another comic book movie. The character arc that Spider-Man goes on in this film is unlike any other Spider-Man movie we have seen, Tom Holland is the perfect person to play this character, he gets Peter Parker bang on and he also nails Spider-Man at the same time. This is easily one of my favourite MCU movies and I really do love this film not just as a Spider-Man film but as a film in general. What a come back for the web slinger!

Author: Dominic_25_
Review_Title: I watched this film in theaters and I'm pretty sure this was when I started to realize that I didn't like the MCU anymore.
Review: Now the assholes who made this mess are getting paid to clean it up.

Author: keal
Review: I can deal with all the changes to the characters. How Aunt May is younger, Flash is a math nerd instead of a jock, Spidey himself being codependent on Tony Stark and the high-tech suit given to him. But why did we have to sit through teenage high school fantasy fumbling? Really? Homecoming was a like a made-for-TV Nickeloden movie. I could care less about how Peter Parker tries to fit back in to his daily life after Civil War. Yay, we skipped a whole origin story this time around - who needs it for Spider-Man after so many reboots, right? But to have to sit through so much 'a day in the life of Peter Parker' was just torturous. After amazing movies like Logan and Guardians of the Galaxy 2,it felt like an insulting step backwards to sit through the teen-fest of Homecoming. Now that Marvel has created a totally integrated 'Universe' to get us to watch every movie because they are all joined to form a bigger, deeper picture, we are goaded into watching even mediocre films like this. Just to keep up with continuity.

Author: cwebb2327
Review: Audience aimed at 11 to 15-year-old teenage boys. Sophomoric and loaded with woke crap. This iteration Peter Parker is not high school, he's in kindergarten. So long Spider-Man we'll miss you.

Author: kphelan-47150
Review: I think Spidey worked better as a side/funny character in Civil War. I don't think a funny version of Spidey can handle serious moments. Also the side characters including Ned, Michelle and Liz come in at random times and don't move the story along. One of my favorite MCU characters is Robert Downey Jr as Iron Man. He was barely in it. Also when he did come in it was at completely random places just so Spiderman did not get hurt. The Vulture was a fine villain but not great. The worst thing about this tough is the pacing. It just jumps from place to place really quickly and sometimes not enough dialogue or action. It feels rushed but at the same time too long.

Author: moziburrahman
Review_Title: It is a Good Movie but Not a Great Movie
Review:
"This movie is enjoyable.I think you will enjoy it.The plot is too predictable.The visual effects are great.Another spider-man reboot.Every reboot Peter Parker gets younger."
--------------------------
Final Verdict
--------------------------
VFX = 9/10
Plot = 6/10
Acting = 8/10
Dialogue = 7/10
------------------------
Final Score : 7/10

Author: nickzjones
Review_Title: Turned Off Expectations and Had a Good Time
Review: Growing up, I remember getting excited about everything that stretched my imagination and took me beyond reality. Spiderman was one of the first characters I latched onto as a child. I have enjoyed most renditions of the character (some more than others). Even in the generally accepted "bad" ones, I found things to like. This movie was unlike all the ones in the past, which I found refreshing since I didn't have to find things to like...I could just watch and enjoy. TBH the way they wove it into the MCU really works, and they left a lot of room for this character to grow.

Author: cdjh-81125
Review: Being completely honest, I wasn't really sold on Spider Man Homecoming on the lead up to its release, I was always an advocate for Andrew Garfield and his interpretation of the character and thought his series came to a premature end. Beyond that the trailers weren't really grabbing me and I wasn't too sure if Tom Holland could carry an entire movie for me, but while I wasn't floored I was pleasantly surprised by what I got.

Author: mfletch79
Review: So here we are again, ANOTHER Spiderman reboot that nobody really wanted. Who'd of thought, Spidey was Tony Starks bitch all along. I have seen ALL of the other recent Spidey movies and this did not add anything new, i'm just glad I didn't have to sit through the whole "bitten by a radioactive spider" story again. Although I thought Tom Holland was a good Spidey he's actually 21 NOT 15, why not get an actual teenager to play PP instead of adult actors having to play kids!! The story and writing were very weak and in general I found the whole film to be rather boring, predictable, irritatingly noisy with the usual set-ups and a less than threatening villain, also PP lives in the most ethnically diverse world ever!! this felt rather forced and fake to me. My problem with these heavily CG films is that you are not actually watching REAL people so therefore there isn't any feel of dread for the characters on screen, who cares if a CG teenager dressed as a spider is being chased by a CG old man dressed as a vulture!! I realise I am not the target audience for this type of film but at the end of the day "a good film is a good film" regardless of the age group it's aimed at. I'm sure early teen boys will find it "awesome" but it left me rather cold and underwhelmed. Definitely not worthy of all the hype.

Author: ashleyjohncontact
Review: Enjoyed this. It's the least serious Spider-Man movie yet, and I think that's just what this reboot-obsessed franchise needed. The marvel touch really worked and didn't feel too much like it was setting up anything. The new younger spider man is great and it's nice to see a DIFFERENT take on the origin story (how many times can we see Uncke Ben dying)

Author: kamenhaven
Review_Title: The Marvel-fication of Spider-Man takes a turn for the worst
Review: This movie is confusing, baffling and outright offensive for a number of reasons. For one, this is a Spider-Man movie that gets its titular character totally wrong. Since when did Spider-Man, the most popular Marvel character who is not only completely capable of holding his own beside some of the most iconic superheroes in the Marvel stable but besting them numerous times over, has to seek any kind of validation or approval from Tony Stark (aka Iron Man) ever? Since when did everything cool about Spidey is attributed to this MCU figure? What happened to the grounded, relatable kid whose primary concerns should be about getting good grades, acquiring a job, paying rent and providing for his aunt? Or the absence of a relative who is the sole motivating factor to Spider-Man becoming who he is? None of these are present or feel like they exist, and these are all crucial touchstones of the Spider-Man story.

Author: mohammedfarooq2
Review: Tom Holland, Michael Keaton, Marisa Tomei and Robert Downey Jr. Star in this 2017 action film based on the Marvel Comics. This picks up not long after the events of "Captain America: Civil War" and Peter Parker (Holland) is starting to get the feel as web-slinging vigilante, Spider-Man. Downey Jr. Reprises his role as Tony Stark/Iron Man who is sort of a mentor to him and he tests Peter's determination to become a superhero. Soon, Peter discovers that there's hi-tech weapons being sold on the streets by salvager, Adrian Toomes (Keaton) who takes the guise of Vulture and he tries to stop him. Tomei (My Cousin Vinny) plays Peter's Aunt, May, Jon Favreau, Chris Evans and Gwyneth Paltrow also reprise their roles from "Iron Man," "Captain America" & "The Avengers." Creator, Stan Lee also makes an amusing cameo as usual. This is a great Spider-Man film, Holland gives the best portrayal of the character so far in my opinion, Keaton is great as usual and the rest of the cast is also good. I recommend this.

Author: TedStixonAKAMaximumMadness
Review_Title: "Spider-Man: Homecoming"- Welcome home, Spidey! A fabulous return for one of the most beloved and iconic comic-book heroes ever created!
Review: Over the past nine years, as Marvel's Cinematic Universe has risen to legendary status in the world of entertainment, there has always been one consistent and never-ending hope in the minds of fans the world over... that perhaps one day, Marvel's iconic and beloved creation Spider-Man could return home and join the ranks of this ever-growing franchise. But it always seemed like such a pipe- dream... Something that could never happen. After all, Sony owned the rights to the character, and had crafted a franchise including some very well- received and wildly successful films centered on the wall-crawler. Heck... still to this day, director Sam Raimi's "Spider-Man 2" is one of the finest comic-book to film adaptations ever released.

Author: scb_coldsteel
Review_Title: Best attempt at a teenage Spider-Man
Review: Finally watched Spiderman Homecoming. Overall it was pretty awesome. The movie had some genuinely funny moments that really captured Spidermans humor. The new Spiderman was a good choice and presented a realistic reflection of teenage Spiderman. I will always be a fan of Spider-Man 1 & 2 by Sam Raimi, but this particular adaptation perfectly captured the teenage Peter Parker.

Author: hnt_dnl
Review: Maybe the Spider-Man movies just aren't for me. I found the Sam Raimi movies to be pure cringe with the very weird and whiny Tobey Maguire and the incredibly pale and unappealing Kirsten Dunst as the object of every man's desire! lol I didn't even like the usually great and reliable James Franco in those films and I've loved him in just about everything else he's done. And WhatHisFace who plays Jameson is such a loud, obnoxious, crummy character. No one on Planet Earth acts like that guy. Now while I somewhat liked the first movie, I hate the silly and cheesy Spider-Man 2, yet most people think that's not only the best Spiderman, but also the best superhero movie ever. And Marvel fans are so obsessed with those movies to the point now they are even daring to even say that Spider-Man 3 was good. That's how desperate people are to cling to those crappy movies. Now to the Marc Webb movies with Andrew Garfield and Emma Stone: I seriously believe that The Amazing Spider-Man is the BEST Spider-Man film of all time, more gritty and mature than the Raimi nonsense and with a cast of much better actors. But Part 2 with Jamie Foxx is so bad I might honestly say it makes the Raimi stuff seem decent by comparison. And this brings me to the new MCU version of Spiderman.

Author: mihai_alexandru_chindris
Review: Holy... Spider-Man is back with a fresh look and ready for action. The best of the best Marvel Studio's movie so far. Don't you think, so? It's well done until its little tiny details, that are hard to observe. Is there something greater than love? Because I love it so much. It's full of "fireworks", and doesn't disappoint anyone. There's so much to say about it, but I have to resume to this: it is absolutely worth the money and time. It deserves some attention.

Author: faizan_hassaan
Review: This is the most irritating movie i have ever seen, this movie is awful and unbearable mainly because of the pathetic acting of Tom Holland, he was so irritating that i enjoyed the scenes where his back side was kicked. Not even a single actor did justice to this character, it felt like every one including the actors and the director were in a hurry to finish it. The movie has the same old plot thus predictable, it has no grip no twist.I wonder who gave this movie more than one star.

Author: jacobjohntaylor1
Review: This is an awesome movie. This movie has a great story line. It also has the best acting. It is one of the best action movies ever. See it. It is a great movie. It is better then Skyfall. It is an awesome movie. If you like great stories you will like this movie.

Author: gabaston
Review: Yes, this is a great movie, and is the best Spiderman's interpretation yet, but isn't the best Spiderman movie... in fact, in my opinion, this one isn't in my top 3 Spiderman movies.

Author: jbrown-62886
Review_Title: So sorry Tom Holland got dragged into this
Review: Admittedly, I liked Tom Holland as Spider-Man. I thought that Toby Maguire was always too over-the-top nerdy. Andrew Garfield was ok also. The rest of the movie was mostly a train wreck.

Author: justinwfirestone
Review: Finally, we get a new actor playing Spider-Man who doesn't have to watch Uncle Ben die. Don't get me wrong, I love watching Uncle Ben get murdered as much as the next movie-goer, but we all have to admit those Uncle Ben deaths were starting to weigh heavy on our minds, much unlike Spider-Man's webs, which are light yet strong.

Author: OlieRendch
Review_Title: A really great Spider-Man movie from beginning to end with Michael Keaton being a huge highlight.
Review: So here we are, the third reboot of Spider-Man, the sixth modern Spider-Man film, the sixteenth entry into the Marvel Cinematic Universe. What can I say? It's actually really great! I enjoyed Spider-Man: Homecoming a lot, right from the opening all the way to literally the end of the credits.

Author: vipulvirus
Review_Title: Good not Great. Movie has been over hyped to some extent but ok
Review: I didn't like Spiderman Homecoming because they showed Peter too much dependence on Stark. Spiderman is an iconic hero who sorts out his foes himself. Iron man and Marvel were too dominant in this one.

Author: fkadurrant
Review: I'm a huge Spider-Man fan and I love this film it's great and the actors are great to!!

Author: alinfatu
Review_Title: Best Spider-Man to hit the big screen
Review: I was introduced to the character by the 90's animated series.Ever since I started reading comics and search for a good live action movie.And finally I found it now.

Author: guisreis
Review: Just the last two sentences of this review may be considered as spoiler. Let's begin: This is the worst official Spiderman movie ever produced. Indeed, it is much more a mix of a silly high school film and a Iron Man film. This Spiderman has very little of Spiderman. First of all, instead of having extreme reflexes, he is quite clumsy, what is nonsense and made the film a bad slapstick comedy. Besides that, what the hell is that Iron Man-like suit with many powers not traditionally related to the spider? Therefore, the fact that this is not really a Spiderman film is bad enough not to consider it a good movie. Though, there are many other problems: most of the action scenes are confusing (like the scenes Transformers franchise bad recent films use to have), there is an excess of jokes with more than 90% of them being bad and silly, acting is unconvincing for most of the main roles (Michael Keaton is clearly an exception)... The movie gets better in the final part, but it is definitely not enough to save it. SPOILER ALERT: By the way: MJ's name is Michelle? Really?!

Author: Pookey-2
Review: I came I watched. Another Spiderman movie from some brainchild over at Sony who feels somehow that we need ANOTHER reboot of this Marvel arachnified offering and of course the truth is that Sony doesn't want to give up the franchise hence they must honor Marvel film commitment. BUT the one thing I am most grateful for is that they didn't SHOW THE BLOODY SPIDER BITE ORIGIN SEQUENCE. Had enough of that already. The film is well made and well processed through the commercial filter that programs us to like what we see before us and that process seems ever so predictable as my body clock ticks onward. It does have some interesting juvenile based dialogue (because Peter Parker is only 15 in this film, why not SPIDER-BOY?)and the high school characters are all plausibly comical in their post pubescent glory. I felt manipulated and partially gangrene by the time this film was over yet I did enjoy the wondrous presence of Michael Keaton who thanks to Birdman (he practically reprises that role in this film), has again graced our panoramic vision of present day cinema and I am ever so grateful he has returned to us like the prodigal son or uncle might be more appropriate. The acting, the special effects are all well and fine and blah blah blah yet somehow I was sick a might in the core of my gut to have been back in a theater seat to gaze upon SPIDER-MAN predictably going to unravel the villain and return to Auntie May (nicely updated by the gorgeous Miss Tomei), and do the usual BS only to return 2 years later in yet another sequel coming soon in 3d Imax in 2019. I am saddened that Hollywood insists on putting out more recycled sludge and apparently doesn't have much of a unique idea in its hollow head anymore. Yet this film is what it is and the key factor for most of you is entertainment and that it is. Im just sick of this kind of entertainment.

Review_Title: Not bad but far from best Spider Man movie
Review: Greetings from Lithuania.

Author: bodhi-13262
Review_Title: "With great POWER......comes a GREAT f#%king movie!!!."
Review: 'Spider-Man: Homecoming' unleashes a whole new bag of tricks as the webcrawler swings his way back onto the silver-screen, but this time......he's (finally) part of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. With Sam Raimi's 2002 film and it's sequel being the most highly praised incarnations of the character, does Spidey have a successful rebooted homecoming?

Author: thepriceofpayne
Review: Being the 3rd Spider-Man reboot in less than 10 years. It's safe to say that this film had a lot to live up to, and I'm happy to say it more than holds in own as a Spider-Man film, a MCU film, and a superhero film. Tom Holland brings all the charm from Civil War and much more to this film, giving us what might be the best incarnation of Spider-Man ever put to film. The movie definitely takes the innocence of its character giving us a lighter story that felt needed and enjoyable. Michael Keaton shines as The Vulture of all characters giving a grounded feel to him, while also admiring the past. In the end great direction, phenomenal performances and a fun script make this film thoroughly enjoyable and memorable. Even if the effects aren't as nice as previous Marvel entries.

Author: FabledGentleman
Review_Title: Not very original, but still lots of fun
Review: I got to hand it to marvel, they manage to spew out one good movie after the other. I don't think i have rated any of their movies bad the last 10 years, but a few have been mediocre.

Author: sbweightman
Review: A fun and entertaining film full of jokes, a great character development arc, and realistic (but still comic book) villain. Top special effects with exciting action scenes throughout with a plot which has a good balance of personal involvement and superhero antics. Good acting and the continuous referrals to the Avengers series works well, but the range of new characters vary in suitability, and the plot is a bit too straightforward overall.

Author: joshfedderson
Review_Title: Spider man as he should be
Review: I went to see the new spider man movie today and I have to say I think out of all the spider man movies they have made, marvel hit gold on this one.

Author: said-buet10
Review_Title: This movie had done a lot of right things
Review: Another reboot which involved MARVEL Studios was bound to be good. This didn't fail to live up to that expectation. This movie is a completely new take on the web-slinging superhero. The masked vigilante for the first time at his teens. And it didn't screw up this incarnation of spider-man rather it gave a new perspective of a young superhero growing up in a post avengers era.

Author: selinakeles
Review: I mean it was almost perfect. This movie is also good for people that don't usually fan over marvel movies. It's like a line where marvel fans and not necessarily "fans" meet. It was an amazing teen movie but it wasn't so easy for grownups and parents to enjoy as well. I'm a hardcore OG first Spider-Man fan with the goat Toby Maguire but we can't ignore the fact that he was way older than his character. Tom Holland looks so young and is actually young! With his great acting skills, he really sells that he is actually Spider-Man. I also loved the casting. Everyone's role did fit. Great job to Tom Holland and even watching his interviews, you can see that there is no one better for the role than Tom. I definitely recommend!

Author: facesofine
Review_Title: A Waste of Tom Holland's Talent
Review: First two thirds was awful; last third was a bit more interesting and bearable. It seemed as if the whole movie pandered to kids of today. The movie started out with Peter's non-stop, shaky video recording of his trip to meet Tony Stark...really?? Throughout the first half of the movie, he just kept whining about not being assigned more missions or be taken seriously by Tony Stark. Peter Parker was never a whiny teen nor some starstruck adolescent who couldn't control his impulses. He was a brainy kid who created and improved upon his own spidey suits. He wouldn't be seduced by any hi-tech fancy gadgets provided by Stark. Although he made the right decision at the end of the movie, which IMHO was the movie's redemption, the earlier premise was a huge disappointment. And what was the point in objectifying Aunt May with all the sexist innuendos and dressing her in sexy clothes (no offense to Marisa Tomei who is beautiful in her own right)? Speaking of Aunt May, did anyone else notice that neither Peter nor his best friend Ned actually addressed her as "Aunt May" and just called her May? Is this what kids do these days, no show of respect to aunts or uncles? I couldn't imagine Peter ever calling Uncle Ben just "Ben." These seemingly small details spoke volumes as to the degradation of respect in this movie. Shame on the writers. While there were moments that elicited a few laughs, the movie overall lacked heart and soul. It was simply a testosterone ride through the CGI world of Tony Stark. Last but not least: stay for the final scene a couple minutes into the credits, then bail out...the very end scene was a cheap trick and a total waste of time. Tobey Maguire's Spiderman movies are still the ones to beat. Even Andrew Garfield's were better. Want a thrilling and inspiring movie? Go see Wonder Woman instead.

Author: saydelette
Review_Title: If you are over 13 don't waste your time
Review: Nothing like the comic book. Just another avenger movie. Spiderman was never that young in the comic. Hard to watch little kids start a relationship. True Spiderman fans will agree with me, Garfield was better, heck even Toby was better. Very disappointing. I will not go see the next, stay away if you are a Spiderman comic fan!

Author: gk-19557
Review: I thought here we go again with another reboot but to be fair it was really good, I enjoyed it, great cast and story, with great effects.

Author: RussHog
Review_Title: Michael Keaton is awesome as Vulture!
Review: Spider-Man: Homecoming is a movie about a kid with super powers who wants to join a super team - but he has to prove that he can learn how to master his powers. At the same time - there is an adult who has chosen a life of crime who has learned full mastery over the technology that grants him powers - and these two are headed for a showdown of good v evil.

Author: DKosty123
Review_Title: Coming Of Age Causes Comic Confusion
Review: Marvel invested a lot in this one, even coming up with Tom Holland, the youngest actor to play Spiderman as a high school student. They loaded the cast with regulars and even gave Stan Lee a credited role. While loading the cast with Keaton, Tomeii, and Downey Junior, they kind of put this edition of Spiderman into a different universe, growing pains. While the script holds together and tells a story, it is a large departure from the comic strip. It is in fact a Comedy. Your friendly neighborhood Spidey gets into action early and often. Iron Man becomes a father figure for him even though the comics never really do that. Stark Industries provides him an Internship and a Spider Suit that is much like Iron Mans. This film is aimed at teenagers. It is the ultimate fantasy in many ways.

Author: nonomkay
Review: First, let me say that the concept of this Spiderman is a sort of light hearted family friendly adventure that would do well for young families. Spidey (Tom Holland) captures the geeky and generally harmless, yet sympathetic and morally driven, character that we all known and love.

Author: gilshoshani
Review_Title: there is marvel and then there is this
Review: some where between meh and bleh is a thin grey area... they also said Zendaya was in here but i must have missed it its the same old formula: hero is born, losses perspective, gets beat up and rises to win once more.

Author: crazyjooster
Review: To start I'll say the only reason this film got 2 stars was Michael Keaton.

Author: MrDHWong
Review_Title: Captures the lighthearted spirit of the titular hero while also keeping it closely in line with the other recent Marvel films
Review: Spider-Man: Homecoming is the second reboot of the Spider-Man franchise and the fourth film of Phase 3 of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Starring Tom Holland in the eponymous role, this film captures the lighthearted spirit of the titular hero while also keeping it closely in line with the other recent Marvel films.

Author: taskeenshaikh-24080
Review_Title: Way higher than my expectation. Really loved this film.
Review: Tom has done a fabulous job. He's the perfect spidy so far. its the best movie, can't get any better :) Spiderman is my favourite superhero and always will be. I highly recommend this film. My rating - 10/10

Author: jadepietro
Review: (RATING: ☆☆☆☆ out of 5 )

Author: banosd
Review_Title: Might restore my interest in super her genre
Review: Although I am generally sick of comic book movies, I gave this a chance because my son wanted to watch it.

Author: skay_baltimore
Review: This latest incarnation of Spider-Man is like a cheesy high school soap opera. (I believe another reviewer said this was like "Spider-Man: High School Musical". S/he was correct.) It's like Spider-Man for Dummies. It tries way too hard to be funny, and it's just not. Marisa Tomei is totally wasted in this mess. I'm not sure what demographic this film is aimed at, but whatever it is, I'm definitely not in it. Rather than fast-paced drama, this film screams: TAKE YOUR ADDERALL ALREADY! Other Spider-Man movies screamed: MARVEL. This one most definitely screams: Disney.

Author: x-07534
Review:
Call me old fashioned, but my favourite Spiderman movie of all time definitely has to be the original one with Tobey Maguire and Kristen Dunst.
They were ALL much better actors, and the movie it self had better screen play, direction, and story lines.
However, the "new Spiderman" (Spiderman: homecoming) was dumb. It portrays Spiderman as some kind of teen wannabe, M.J is a goth with no emotion, and the work "Mr. Stark" had to be mention like a million times!
This is not Avengers people, its Spiderman, and Hollywood just ruined the movie of my favorite superhero!

Author: mastersparky
Review_Title: I spy a new kid on the block.
Review: *Contains some small spoilers* I gave myself a few days to write this review as I wanted the time to process it and to be sure I wasn't simply being swept away in the hype machine that surrounds this release. I'm pleased to say that after careful consideration I've decided that my initial reaction still stands. This is my favourite Spiderman movie so far and it also rates as one of the top Marvel films to date too.

Author: Cruise2061
Review: Badly done to the point of irritation. I have been a Spidey fan since comics were 5c a copy and hoped Marvel would finally get it right.

Author: qmgfqr
Review: Its average movie. The main villain Vulture is more like tony stark's villain and not the true spidey's antagonist. Tom holland's take on peter parker aka the vigilante Spider-Man does not quite hit the mark as Tobey McGuuire's does. During the whole movie its like watching peter parker trying to correct the past mistakes and sins of tony stark. Rivalry between vulture and Spider-Man doesn't feel like true rivalry.

Author: elicberkley
Review: I thought it was a great movie. Me, not being a marvel fan in general, was curious about this movie because spider-man has always been my favorite marvel superhero. Between the language and violence(especially towards the end) merits the PG-13 rating. I'd still say it's good for kids 11+

Author: slicedbread117
Review: February 9th, 2015; Marvel announced their partnership with Sony to bring everybody's favorite wall-crawler to the prestigious Marvel Cinematic Universe, leaving fans dying of excitement to get a glimpse of one of the most iconic superheroes of all-time in Marvel's expansive film universe. After getting more or less of a tease in last year's 'Civil War', we finally get our first full taste of Spidey in the MCU, a film that, without question, puts the web-slinger back on the map with what I would consider to be the best Spider-Man film to date.

Author: gmwatling
Review: Although I have rated this film an 8 out of 10, I feel personally that it is a 10 out of 10 but there is something about it that makes me only give it an 8 out of 10. I personally loved the film and thought that it was amazing it never once lost my attention and I was laughing the whole way though it. I don't really have a bad thing to say about it as a film. It is a family friendly film that I would highly recommend to anyone who has not seen this yet. As a teenager my self, who is roughly the same age as Spiderman in the film, it is easy to relate to as he is in school and is having trouble getting the girl of his dreams, however he is not the broad bravo that catches her eye all the time. While the film itself is a mixture of Action, Adventure and Comedy it fuses together to make one action packed comedy, while at the same time doubling as a relatable story to teenagers watching it as well as anyone else. Follow me on Instagram @gabewatling and Twitter @gmwatling, check out my blog www.a2media2k17.weebly.com

Author: paragdt
Review: Just watched the movie for the third time, and this time solely for Michael Keaton. What a filmography this guy has ! A protagonist, an antagonist, a superhero and now,the antagonist to a superhero - he has played it all. Truly amazing to see him as the Vulture. Menacing in his own ways.

Author: TheOneThatYouWanted
Review: I made the mistake of watching Spider-man 2 (2004) a day before watching this. Regardless, this film is a blast. Hats off to the acting all around. I think the script was well written for what it wanted to do, introduce a bunch of new characters and world building; the problem is that didn't leave enough room to explore the awesome new villain, or flush out the action scenes with more tension. So yeah, this movie isn't the best Spider-man movie, I'll rank it the 3rd best behind those first two from the original series. I have a good feeling about the sequel because this film does a great job of setting things up and putting characters into place; considering this is the second reboot, they did a good job.

Author: Mysterygeneration
Review_Title: The first standalone Spider-Man film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe to include the actor who played Batman.
Review: This film follows Spider-Man, who is in high school and has an alter ego named Peter Parker. We see Peter's friends here, who are different (but some are the same) from those in the previous Spider-Man flicks, including Ned. Ned has never appeared in a Spider-Man film. Ned is supposed to be Peter Parker's true pal.

Author: kennethmcdaniel
Review: I'm writing this review because I've been reading some of the negative reviews and just want to clarify some subjects on the matter up. Now I'm not the oldest person on the internet but I can say that they were spot on with making this film more of a high school drama. The people who wrote these characters did a spectacular job with the characters in high school. Personally right now I'm in high school and when I look at the old Spider-Man movies and I see a "bully" I start to actually laugh because that's not how bullies are! They did the right thing by making Flash a regular guy who's just more popular then other people that's how bullies are now a days. The villain is also in my top three of best marvel movie villains. And casting Tom Holland as Spider-Man was brilliant. He looks the age of the part and acts very well and I'm glad they gave him a nerdy best friend because that's what Spider-Man needed. All in all this film is written and directed spectacularly!

Author: RNMorton
Review: So Toby Maguire did a nice job but always looked a little too old for the title character. And there were other problems with the early Spiderman, too much slow romantic entanglement and unentanglements, plus derivative plots. E.g., Spiderman III has some great fight scenes a lot of dreary moments and a plot derivative even from its own earlier movies. I didn't like the second Spiderman, skipped II on that. This Spiderman feels quite right, the movie gets extra juice having Tony Stark involved but that's somewhat of a mixed blessing, I might have liked to see a little less Stark in the plot. Michael Keaton has always been a favorite for me, the best movie Batman, and he plays a finely textured villain in this one. Enjoyable movie, they could have cut 10-15 minutes running time without losing anything.

Author: JakeBrinkman
Review_Title: Holland secures himself in the role
Review: Maguire was a good Parker but a poor Spider-Man. Garfield was a good Spider-Man but a poor Parker. Holland manages to excel at both, making him a thoroughly enjoyable character.

Author: yoshbuck
Review: This movie perfectly captures the teen essence. And this is one of the best teen hero movies of the 2010s. Peter wants to be the best hero and thinks a hero is looking for danger to have some action. His character captures the true teen essence of Peter Parker, which no other installment has done before besides Into The Spiderverse. After Civil War, Marvel needed a strong debut, and they did. I wasn't a fan the first time watching it, but this movie grew on me over time. From the excellent side characters from Peter's classmates like his best friend Ned and the new MJ by Zendeaya, the teachers are pretty enjoyable. But the best side character is the villain, the Vulture, and Tony Stark. The Vulture is all business. He isn't intimidating but portrays the most common villain, the ordinary person who wants to get CREAM (money), not for greed but as a necessity. And Tony Stark is a natural mentor towards being a better superhero. This film is an excellent Spider-Man movie. And this movie justifies Tom Holland taking the role.

Author: rachelrose-87356
Review: Play Spider-Man: Homecoming! It is fast and easy to view! A good way to spend your time. Be the best!

Author: photonex68-122-496836
Review: "Spider-Man: Homecoming" was entertaining in the way popcorn flicks are, but I found it lacking in substance. As with most Marvel movies, the audience is apparently supposed to just play passive observer, willingly suspending not just disbelief but also suspending any impetus to actually think about what's happening on the screen. So sure, "Spider-Man: Homecoming" is a nice film if you want something essentially mindless, but the writing doesn't rise above the average Marvel movie. The best part of the movie is Michael Keaton's Vulture, and honestly, even that isn't saying much. I walked out of the theater liking the movie for what it was but having no desire to see it again until it hits the small screen.

Author: IQ42
Review: Spider-Man was introduced in the last Captain America movie and now he got his own movie. It is more light-hearted and more suited towards the younger audience being from the view of a high-schooler.

Author: bryangary65
Review: Well too many spider man movies in my opinion.

Author: prazer-paulo
Review_Title: Just an entertainment movie, without any compromise with original character past.
Review: I would like to understand why Marvel insists to disrespect the original history of greatest super hero of all the time. Watching this movie I felt like Peter Parker was a unknowing character, created exclusively to teenagers that don't know nothing about originals Spiderman HQs.

Author: SAMTHEBESTEST
Review: SPIDERMAN HOMECOMING REVIEW : I'm a Spiderman Fan from childhood, old Spider Man films series (3 films) is still my favourite. The Amazing Spiderman couldn't match the class of that old Spiderman but i liked it for some advanced technology used in it. Now comes SpiderMan Homecoming, Another spidey film excited too much before release, don't know how but i started expecting Best Spidey film ever but this one too couldn't match the standard of Old Spiderman series.

Author: JWick23
Review_Title: I was wrong about you kid..
Review: The best Spider man representation compared to the last couple of films from the past two decades. Even though there are some slight differences it doesn't take the movie away from it's purpose of a true spiderman spirit.

Author: one9eighty
Review: This Spiderman movie brings the titular web-head under Marvel Studios and into the Marvel Cinematic Universe - finally!

Author: mjjaleel
Review_Title: Average movie. Not as good as other Marvel movies.
Review: TBH the movie was average. Didn't like it as much as the other movies in MCU. I think Guardians,Strange,Deadpool and the Iron Man movies have set a benchmark for humor and this spidey flick struggles to reach or even come close to them.﻿ The story is slow paced and fails to move you in scenes where Peter/Spiderman struggles physically and emotionally.

Author: lgd-79669
Review: Love this movie. Very rewatch able with some very strong charecter performances. Personally thought Michael Keaton was amazing in this and atom Holland introduced the spirderman charecter extremely well. It bought a new light to the Spider-Man films and MCU. However some of the plot for me was a bit predictable but that still lead for an intense and fun movie experience which I thoroughly enjoyed and would watch again.

Author: pootc

Author: tbills2
Review_Title: Spider-Man: Homecoming Marvel What Have You Done To Peter Parker???????????????????????????? im asking
Review: In S-M:H Peter Parker is the biggest doucheregal in the history of doucheregals he's as smart as a doucheregal and he acts like a total DoucheRegal the whoooole movie long & it's kind of funny because Peter Parker/Spider-Man/Spiderman is totally NOT a doucheregal at all based off a consensus understanding and the fans undying love for our comic book hero did you know Peter Parker is actually hyper intelligent with a beautiful, cunning disposition & he is definitely not a doucheregal let alone the biggest douche......I LOVE THIS MOVIE BUT THEY made Peter Parker pure, annoying, doucheregally. Marisa Tomei is my all time favorite movie babe I'm not even kidding anymore I'm sick of it. I love Marisa so much God she's gorgeous all-time! I love Marisa Tomei. Author: alexiswilliams-42538
Review: This is such a crappy movie. Tom Holland is wimpy and not cute. He is playing a 15 year old and it isn't believeable. I think Tumblr users imagined this movie up...I am sure Disney is hiring them now. They had to bring Robert Downey Jr in the ensure people would run to see it.

Author: Batman-20
Review: Excellent movie! The real Peter Parker has now entered the stage.

Author: onetimebox
Review: We begin this caper with home movies reviewed by none other than Peter Parker. Happy lugs our neighborhood web slinger off to Berlin to face Captain America. After many a cut scene and conversations on how much chatter a fight requires , Parker is sent back to his Burrough and the exciting world of high school. We settle in as Parker deals with problems minor and inconsequential all over NYC. Exactly where Stark wants him. His life begins to pass in a blur of debate practice , number 9 sandwiches and adventures in Lego Star Wars. Sadly , the teenage dream is about to become a real world nightmare.

Author: FallenEye
Review: Did you notice that, just like a vulture, Keaton's Adrian Toomes scoured the streets of New York, picking at dead metal, in an attempt to salvage what was left, in order to feed his family?

Author: dakotadickenson-83457
Review_Title: A great start for the new Spider-Man
Review: After making his on screen debut as Peter Parker/Spider-Man in Captain America: Civil War, Tom Holland returns once again in his own feature film, that is still learning the ropes of being Spider-Man, while also being taken under Tony Stark/Iron Man's wing to be the next new Avenger. When weapons of mass destruction start making their ways to the streets of New York, Peter Parker must use his skills and learn the ropes of being a full time superhero as he goes as he battles his first big threat known as Vulture. So for starters, Tom Holland is hands down the MCU's Spider-Man bringing us the geeky and awkward side of Peter Parker to life just like the comics. The best part of this film is hands down Michael Keaton's Adrian Toomes/Vulture. He shows us in this film that he can be not just a convincing villain, but a great villain if that with a higher purpose who wasn't always bad and always try's to do the right thing for the people he loves. Marisa Tomei as May Parker I have to say is my favorite actress to ever portray the character. Zendaya as Michelle "MJ" Jones I thought at the time was a odd casting since they didn't get much screen time in this film, but was fitting for the role. Jacob Batalon is definitely the funniest character of the film and one of my favorite of all of Peter Parker's friends in a Spider-Man movie. Lastly, Robert Downey Jr as Tony Stark/Iron Man is fantastic as always being the mentor for Spider-Man and teaching him what it means to be a hero. Overall, this is a fantastic film to kick off Spider-Man being in the MCU that makes you want more of him by the end. Rating 9/10.

Author: Jitatman
Review_Title: Younger than Tobey Maguire's Spider-man, which is Refreshing..
Review: Jesus.. Sorry, Oh Bhagwan.. It was Amazing.. You know what I mean ;) It was Amazing than the Amazing Spider-man.

Author: dimskodras
Review: I was 15 years old when Raimi's Spiderman hit the big screen and I was amazed by how real he made him look. It could be the young age but it was so well presented that it made you feel like Spiderman could actually be a real person out there. Raimi made almost everything feel believable and when you a fantasy movie makes you feel like that you know there's been some effort put into its making.

Author: martinsplads
Review: Spider-Man homecoming its a movie for kids. The only times this movie actually was a film for grownups was when the main villain the vulture was on the screen. When Michael Keaton is getting full on psycho on Tom Hollands Spidey the film worked for me. But when he is not available in the picture the movie as I said is like watching a cheesy cartoon movie for children, and that really bored me a lot. The movie is by all means a bit entertaining so it gets 4 four stars from me, but could've have been so much better, really disappointing.

Author: lev-nemkin
Review_Title: Better than The Amazing Spider-Man and Raimi's trilogy...
Review: I finally saw this tonight was looking forward to it ever since I heard about it and when I saw the trailer I was even more pumped for it and I was not disappointed this was a pretty good movie I really did enjoy it Tom Holland was the perfect Peter Parker/Spider-Man I didn't like the fact how he never really did anything about his love interest though I mean he asked her to the homecoming dance then left her there that was about it but he was great as the friendly neighborhood Spider-Man for sure and we did have your side characters like Flash,MJ except this time her name was Michelle not Mary Jane I'm kind of fine that they changed that the girl was this loner didn't have any friends but later on kind of made some she was a pretty awesome character and Peter's love interest Liz was great but the character I was most surprised about was Marisa Tomei as Aunt May I didn't expect her to be that great but she was amazing I thought I'm glad they went for a younger actress this time...I also liked the villain Adrian Toomes/Vulture which also turned out to be Liz's father which I was not expecting that was a shocker for me and Tony Stark was great as his mentor kind of prepping him to be in the Avengers he offered him a place closer to the end but he turned it down also there was a scene on a ferry that kind of reminded me of one of the other Spider-Man movies. The Amazing Spider-Man was good for the Spider- Man origin story but this movie was great because of Tom Holland he is definitely the best Spider-Man I was glad when he made an appearance in Captain America Civil War I was excited because he finally would get to be in the Avengers but it was just one mission and was hyped to see more of him and was really satisfied I can't wait for the sequel give this a 9/10 highly recommend it this is better than The Amazing Spider-Man 1,2 and Raimi's Spider-Man Trilogy altogether although the origin story in The Amazing Spider-Man was great but this movie is better Andrew Garfield is not the best Spider-Man to me he's second best.

Author: ricoj-05529
Review_Title: Spiderman, spiderman, Doesn't do what a spider can?
Review: An interesting take on Spiderman. A new "millennial" outlook if you will. Some may love it, some may hate it. I thought it was done very well actually. A superhero film is only as good as it's villain and I think Vulture was the standout here for me. A lot of Perter's highschool "associates" were generic and just not that interesting to me.

Author: chickenjackson
Review_Title: reminds us that Spider-Man is just a kid
Review: Definitely a fun movie, with a great villain (played by batman himself :p), as you see what happens when an inexperienced and overeager teenager is granted super-powers. This reboot captures what has made peter parker such an enduring and endearing character...a nerdy teen who uses humor as deflection and who often finds his well intentions hurting the ones he loves. The best moments in the film reminded me that the heroism of spider-man is that even though he's just a kid he chooses to bear the weight of such great responsibility.

Author: shawn_m_roeder
Review: I love comic book movies. However, it gets tiresome watching the continued parade of super villains with grand agendas to take over and/or destroy the world. Michael Keaton's well-played Vulture has no such grand designs. He just wants to support his family comfortably, even if his business is less than legal. He uses the deeds of those who are more rich and powerful than him as justification. That's it. No grand designs to take over the world, and no deliberate attempt at mass destruction (although that accompanies any decent comic book movie regardless). When teenager Peter Parker interferes with those plans, the only revenge plot is to keep Spider-man from interfering with his family business. Again, simple plans. It is the simplicity of the villain and the superhero that made this movie a breath of fresh air in comparison with its competitors. This is one of the best comic book movies since The Dark Knight.

Author: bora_mustafa
Review_Title: Is this the worst Spider-Man movie ever made? No but its damn close!!!
Review: Spider-Man has always been my favourite superhero and the Sam Raimi trilogy, in my opinion is still the definitive Spider-Man series, it may not be perfect but it's still the best series. I'll keep it short with the Amazing films, I did not like either film and Andrew Garfield as Spider-Man/Peter Parker felt miscast it was a doomed reboot from the start.

Author: scott-sw
Review_Title: Spider-Man Swings Back to the Top
Review: Spider-Man Homecoming is appropriately named, finally bringing our favorite web-slinger home to fun, lighthearted fun. After the Raimi- Maguire era came to an ignoble stop, and after Garfield's gloomy, glum, grim take bottomed it out, Spidey is swinging strong. This is the best since the apex of Raimi's Spider-Man 2 over a decade ago. We begin immediately after the Avengers defeat of the Chitari in New York when Adrian Toomes (Michael Keaton) is scavenging through the alien technology. He was contracted to do so, but then ingloriously kicked to the curb by the government and Tony Stark/Ironman (Robert Downey, Jr.) He takes some for himself to research and use. Kick forward to near present day when Peter Parker/Spider-Man (Tom Holland) helps the Stark Team against the Cap Team in Civil War. Then, we return to New York where Stark tells Spider-Man he will be an asset to the Avenger and to wait for his call. Spidey is now relegated to the kids table while Happy Hogan (Jon Faverau) "monitors" his progress. The adults tend to ignore Peter Parker as he gives minor help and juggles his life at high school. He still wants to prove himself, and eventually stumbles across Toomes' team as they try to sell weapons fueled by alien technology, and rob from ATMs. Happy and Tony tell Spidey to stay out of the big stuff, but not much else. Spidey is desperate to prove he is ready and pursues the low-lying crime syndicate on his own. He does a few impressive things, but eventually, his endeavors backfire. Tony Stark/Ironman has to bail him out, and takes the suit. Alone, Spidey has to figure out how to save the day. There are a few gripes to get out of the way. First is the Spider-Man suit from Stark can do as much as the Ironman suit. This takes away from Peter's ingenuity and creativity he displays in the comics. Secondly, the Aunt May character is underused, undeveloped, and miscast. And this seems to be a conscious decision by writers and producers to focus on the Peter Parker cadre at school. Aunt May is a prominent character, and can show all of strength as Rosemary Harris proved in Spider-Man 2. Finally, the lacking of adults in the movie spreads to the crew as well. With the focus on high school, mostly Peter's peers, it is a high school movie. Of course, Peter is in high school, and attempting to reconcile his aspirations for peers and his responsibility. On the other hand, the strengths of homecoming outpace this missteps. The first kudos is to Tom Holland who portrays the web-slinger with such conflict, hope, and frustration so well. Between his anger with Happy and Tony, and reconciling his disappearances with Aunt May and his friends, and trying to impress the Avengers, Holland gives us an earnest performance. The audience will believe he is 16. Just as good is Michael Keaton as Adrian Toomes. As a Spider-Man comic collector, I never held the Vulture is high regard. That goes the opposite way in this cinematic adaptation. This was the best villain since Doc Ock in Spider-Man 2. He does garner sympathy to a certain extent, but Keaton gives the Toomes character the right amount of bitterness, anger, and desperation. Finally, there is a Spider-Man who has to reckon with being a kid and wanting to be an adult with adult figures failing him. As a kid, he makes mistakes because he does not stop to think things through. This is Spider-Man movie of the future. It works, and works well. It still does not have the power and gravitas of the original Raimi/Maguire movies (1-2), but it is a great one for the ages.

Author: Abranth-d
Review: Here's my review of spiderman : homecoming. So , Tom Holland was great as spiderman . He was funny , athletic and smart just like how you saw him in civil war. Michael Keaton was great as the vulture , even though he could have been a little more intimidating , not just the bad guy , the whole plot could've been a little dark , it was too cheesy , I'm not saying bad , but it was cheesy like its TV series . Some things which pissed me off , was how spiderman talked to the AI in his suit and depended a lot on stark tech , because spiderman talks to himself while swinging by and one of the original traits of his is not depending on tech except for his web shooters . The supporting cast was great too , especially the fat Asian dude . Aunt may was good in this movie , but more uncle Ben memories would have boosted the emotional drive , which was lacking in this movie. Iron man was cool , and he knew his place without crowding it. The music in this movie is really cool and that too how they did a remix to the classic theme song which blended really well with the action sequences. In the end , homecoming is a perfect summer movie with lots of cheesiness , web slinging fun and wall crawling action and perfectly timed one liners. Oh yes , there's a post credits scene and an end credits scene , the end credits scene however ... Just watch it .

Author: tbarfield23
Review_Title: Solid action, Tom Holland is a great Peter Parker
Review: I thought this was one of the best Spidey films which Michael Keaton proving to be a great villain. Tom Holland just seems to wear the mantle of Peter Parker so much better than the Tobey McGuire or Andrew Garfield. The only complaint I had about the movie was Ned. He was, undoubtedly, the most annoying characters in the film.

Author: Badmoviessuck
Review: This movie is great and is one of the best marvel films i have ever seen with a critical eye.

Author: kaden_lewis
Review: This is the best Spider-Man movie ever made. Unlike the other Marvel movies, this was a reboot, and has very high expectations to live up to. It succeeded all expectations spectacularly. However, it did so in a very unique way. Marvel took a risk, instead of doing the usual uncle Ben dying, and Peter getting bitten by the Spider, they jumped right into the movie. Of course the only reason they did this was because Spider-Man already got introduced in Civil War, and that was 6 months after he got bit. They also completely changed some of the classic Spider-Man characters, and introduced some new ones. A good example was Flash. In Toby Maguire's, and Andrew Garfield's Spider-Mans, Flash was a huge bully, in this Spider-Man, Flash is still somewhat of a bully, but not in a physical way, he is also smaller, and even smarter. This is the third version of Spider-Man, and we got a third girlfriend. The original one had MJ, Andrew Garfield's has Gwen Stacy, and now we have Liz. It was cool how they built the story around Liz's dad being the main villain, the Vulture, they haven't really done that with a Spider-Man girlfriend before. We also got introduced to Ned, and different MJ who isn't Mary Jane. I though Ned was great, he silliness gave me a couple good laughs. I also liked MJ's character, I can't wait to see more of her, especially since her role will get bigger in the next Spider-Man movies. The last thing I will talk about it the acting, it was all great, from Peter's friends, to Michael Keaton as the Vulture, to the younger aunt May, but Tom Holland's was amazing. Out of the three Spider-Mans, Toby Maguire, Andrew Garfield, and Tom Holland, I think Tom was the best. He was great, and he just had younger more high school vibe than the others.

Author: giannis_maggos
Review_Title: Not the Best Spider man movie but the Best Spider man of all time that's for sure
Review: Since I was a little Kid i was a huge Spider man fan both comics and The animated tv series and I have to say that this is movie is far from perfect but Tom Holland is the Best Spider man ever. Period

Author: travishouze
Review_Title: Spider-Man: Homecoming Spins a New Web
Review: Only a mere 15 years ago, I was astonished to see Spider-Man's first big appearance on the big screen played by Tobey Maguire. While that trilogy hasn't aged too well, there was a fresh energy still there when superhero films began to take a more human route. The Amazing Spider-Man films, however, lacked any real impact or relevancy for me. So Spider-Man: Homecoming had a lot riding on the film more than just "we got Spidey home".

Author: thecamillocienfuegos
Review: The problem with remakes is, you don't really get to start again. And the problem with franchise movies is, they have to carry the baggage of the franchise.

Author: bob the moo
Review_Title: Enjoyable, entertaining, and slick with plenty to engage
Review: I watched this film a day or so after watching Wonder Woman, a film which had disappointed by how meh it all was throughout. I came into this one expecting it to be yet another by-the-numbers superhero film, but was reminded by it how well Marvel have delivered their franchise. By all rights, this film should be a disaster. It is the third reboot of the character in recent years, it is part of a massive infrastructure of characters and stories, and it enters a very heavily saturated marketplace. How then does it manage to seem so effortless in what it does?

Author: direspecie
Review: I really enjoyed these movie and I think it's better than The Amazing Spider-Man. The movie is fun and interesting; Tom Holland is amazing, the villain is very good and the rest of the cast it's good to, Especially Keaton. I really appreciate the vulnerability (inexperience and his evolution) of Peter/Spider-Man and the motivation of the villain. The plot and the Screenplay are good with a surprising revelation in the conclusion of the film. Other good thing is Iron Man, only appear when it's necessarily. Spider-Man: Homecoming is fun, surprising and a solid movie reboot.

Author: marc5477
Review_Title: Yet another insult to highly intelligent people
Review: I get it, smart people scare normal people because they cannot understand how they got so smart. But to blatantly say that we are evil and jealous of normal intellects who are rich or powerful is nonsense and just proves that normal people really dont understand us at all. Rich and powerful are not things that turn us into evil beings... we are not you.

Author: matthewparkin-35963
Review: Tom Holland has given the best portrayal of Spider-Man out of any of these films. The movie has a well built story that embraces its surroundings by including other characters in the MCU and utilising them in a interesting way that also benefits the other characters from other films. Very well done.

Author: tom_saint
Review_Title: It is a true spidey of his times
Review: I think, Tom Holland, incarnate the closest Peter Parker to date Very carefree, talkative and funny. But I was very choked with the hi-tech suit, I said 'what the hell', the abilities of Spidey are skin-deep and not technological..

Author: manigma
Review: I went to see Spider-Man: Homecoming last day last show with my son (10). Been watching superhero movies from a while and my expectations were not high. But I was really surprised how well this movie has been made. Everything was brilliant, loved story, humor, inspiration, Stark tech.

Author: chapsdanger
Review: They decided to make Spider-Man 15. Any problems that you can imagine with the main character being 15, happen in this movie. Not being able to drive, going to the big dance, not embarrassing yourself in front of the girl, exactly what you always wanted out of Spider-Man. If you always dreamed of a child Spider-Man, this movie would be for you. For everyone else that grew up before 2010, this movie is not for you. I don't think anything else needs to be said. With great power comes great responsibility, and this movie is just plain irresponsible.

Author: hammerhorg
Review:
I mean it could be Worse, to be honest with you Homecoming has a pretty mediocre story, some ok actions scenes, overuse of CGI and great acting.
I think were the film suffers the most is the storyline. The storyline is pretty predictable and i do not think the film needed iron man.
There are some jokes which weren't that bad and i love Ned, i think micheal Keaton did a spectacular job as the vulture and I think Tom holland is not that bad of a spider-man.

Author: evanston_dad
Review: Thought I'd give this franchise a try even though a mostly hate Marvel movies.

Author: jtrporrelli
Review: Being the third film adaptation of Spider-Man in a little over a decade, with five other movies coming before it, along with having six writers and a no-name director, Homecoming had a lot to live up to. Luckily, it's able to surpass its predecessors. The best thing being the size of the story. Comic Spider-Man has always been the "neighbourhood" hero, but in this film, his challenges are barely important enough for Ironman's assistant. It's intimate and real thanks to the cast's impeccable performances, delivering a Peter Parker who drives the narrative of the story forward rather than allowing the story to unravel around and carry him.

Author: preben_hassel
Review_Title: I don't care about the crying fanboys, I loved it.
Review: Spiderman is back with a new face, a new suit and a whole lot of new problems. Finally, we received what we cried out for. Spidermans REAL introduction to the Avengers universe.

Author: Lejink
Review: So I'm trying to sort of haphazardly backtrack my way through some of these Marvel Cinematic Universe movies if only to keep up with the next one. This one has about six degrees of separation from Benedict Cumberbatch's Dr Strange character I've lately been watching which is why I belatedly dropped in on our friendly neighborhood Spider Man although I have seen one or two of the previous incarnations of the character starring Toby Hooper and Andrew Garfield.

Author: destinylives52
Review: "Spider-Man: Homecoming" is a successful, fresh start to one of the most loved, Marvel Comics character. Playing a 15-year-old Peter Parker/Spidey is Tom Holland, who is perfect for the role, and better at it than any other actor who played the webslinger in previous movies and TV specials (yes, there were live-action, Spider-Man TV specials a long time ago). After coming home from his epic battle in Europe ("Captain America: Civil War"), Holland is back in Queens, NYC, itching for a new mission from his mentor, Tony Stark/Iron Man (played by Robert Downey Jr.). But his dream of another epic fight doesn't come, and Holland is forced to do street level superhero stuff while juggling the cruelties and confusion of High School.

Author: odaleg
Review:
Film quite entertaining and more comical compared to what Marvel has done, except for Guardians of the Galaxy. It takes more than half a film to catch pace and once it does it speeds up too much and everything happens in a very short space of time. Spiderman is presented to us as someone overly immature who fights against a villain who has no charisma, but has more background and motivations than Spiderman.
Entertaining movie, and no more.

Author: DeBBss
Review: I was very confident that Spider-Man: Homecoming was going to be great, and I was right, but I just wished it was going to be similar to the original, and it is, but it didn't set up everything like it did in the original, but i'm pretty sure no-one would want to see an origin story again.

Author: daddysarm
Review_Title: good enough that I'll watch the next one BUT
Review: This is WAY BELOW the first couple of Sam Raimi and Tobey Mcguire films. The writing is far worse. The villain is almost a joke. I guess he is supposed to be an evil, amateurish version of T Stark & I'll guess that we will see him & his daughter in another film someday. If not, WOW, they did NOTHING with that character. And, they seemed to make the fight scenes as slapdash as possible since this spideyboy doesn't even know how to fight.

Author: southdavid
Review: A second viewing of "Spiderman Homecoming" following the home release of the film. I recently reviewed "Thor Ragnorok" following its home release and determined that it wasn't quite as good the second time around, as I remembered so much of it. Interestingly, "Spiderman: Homecoming" seems to have the opposite effect, and is even better this time that it was the first time.

Author: Hayden-86055
Review: Yet another MCU film in the form of "Spiderman", a word I use quite unwillingly here as the story resembles little of Spiderman. For starters the suit is basically Iron man's armour, it speaks to Peter and everything, not at all right. Spiderman Homecoming takes too much inspiration from Iron Man and doesn't have enough uniqueness to stand on its own feet, the direction was too different to the older Spiderman films and no where near as good.

Author: Pedro_MiguelC
Review: Spider-Man: Homecoming is totally different from Tobey's and Andrew's movies, it might bother many, but we have to open our minds to new projects. Spiderman Homecoming is a smaller-scale teenage film with a simple script that knows how to be complex when it wants to. Tom Holland and Michael Keaton shine in performances.

Author: bowmanblue
Review_Title: Where we all wanted him to be
Review: Everyone seemed to like the Tobey Maguire 'Spiderman' trilogy (although less said about 'Part III' the better), some people were okay with the Andrew Garfield reboot, but then all five films came along before Marvel's 'shared universe' really kicked off. As soon as it became 'the norm' to see Captain America crossing over with Iron Man, Thor and the like, everyone wanted to see their favourite web-slinger swinging alongside them. However, it seemed that there was one force more powerful than a thousand Infinity Gauntlet-wielding Thanos - studio film rights. Sony held the rights to Spiderman, rather than Disney, so, after much wrangling, it was decided that Sony would allow Disney to include him into their 'shared universe' (hence creating the 'Homecoming' part of the title). And the result is pretty good.

Author: TheHonestCritic
Review_Title: Does Tom Holland do better as Spider-Man/Peter Parker than Andrew Garfield? Check out my review below!
Review: "Spider-Man: Homecoming" (2017), most of you guys already know that I absolutely loathe "The Amazing Spider-Man" films with Andrew Garfield. He's such a disgrace to the character of Spider-Man/Peter Parker! Tobey Maguire is, and will always be Spider-Man. But, when I saw Tom Holland as the character in "Captain America: Civil War" (2016), I didn't think he did that bad. His performance isn't as great as Tobey Maguire's in that movie. That being said, he's a much better actor for the character than Andrew Garfield! I wasn't too keen on seeing "Spider-Man: Homecoming" to begin with. But, since Robert Downey Jr. Was going to be in it, I gave it a chance. It was better than I thought it was going to be. However, the more I watched it, the more I disliked it. More flaws began to unravel in this tangled up web of a "film"! "Spider-Man: Homecoming" has a boring and slow storyline, standard to terrible acting, and an predictable generic soundtrack to try and tie this diarrhea stain together. The plot is, Peter Parker attempts to balance his life as Spider-Man with his personal life, but ends up running into conflicts along the way. Yeah, it's about as basic a story as it sounds. It's way too pedestrian, and it never really shines for me. One glaring issue I have with this "movie", is that we never see how this version of Spider-Man/Peter Parker got his powers in the first place. Granted, it's not something we have to see, as most of us know how it all began in the first place. We're all just supposed to watch it and accept it. Another problem, is that there's no Uncle Ben in this "film". He's never even mentioned here! Did none of the writers read a comic book? Or, do any research?
