Author: thelastjedi_good
Review_Title: Kevin Feige makes Spider-Man just another guy, but it's fine I guess
Review: We all know that Spider-Man's silver screen legacy is extremely controversial. With three incarnations of the character existing in the short span of 15 years, it's impossible not to compare every reboot to the last. How does this one compare? It's a decent effort, but Homecoming isn't as deep or as personal as Spidey's past exploits, largely because of its ties to the great Marvel machine.

Author: hellsnavy16
Review_Title: Welcome Peter Parker, for the first time - to the big screen
Review: i have spent hours and hours in years past - probably hundreds, reading and re-reading the comic books of the 1980s, the golden age of marvel comics, and the golden age of spider man. Spiderman is indeed the greatest superhero of marvel comics, possibly the greatest superhero ever created. he's a proxy for the audience, a way to make a hero relatable - his life has very pronounced ups and downs, and when it's time to show courage he has it in spades. he's both awkward, but can be funny. he is insecure, more human than other superheros. this movie version delivers on the spirit of the best run of comics books. the movie includes some of the greatest moments from the comic book such as peter overcoming his helplessness and gathering all of his strength. you can tell marvel did not reboot the character just to make a buck, they took great care to craft a good story, it has the signature marvel humor which is always nice, Jon favreau is good in it, while Robert Downy Jr. makes one of his best appearances as tony stark in a sort of father figure for peter and it is quite nice. Marisa tomei makes a surprisingly great, uncharacteristically sexy aunt may. which worked very well. peter's love interest is stupidly gorgeous and she kept me enthralled whenever she was on screen. peter's sidekick is also great, and the casting for peter was quite good, he nailed peter's personality overall. the villain was very charismatic and a great performance by Michael Keaton who was recently nominated for an academy award. in fact the whole cast of actors is just perfect. the only reason i am not giving this movie better score than an eight is because i think they can really kick this into overdrive with a sequel, if they don't rush to make a trilogy. there's some social commentary that i thought it was a bit much. other than that - amazing movie, must watch.

Author: edwardcooper-92204
Review_Title: Spiderman Homecoming is a mixed bag.
Review: Spiderman Homecoming is a mixed bag. In fact, it is pretty much two separate films- one concerning the awkward Peter Parker and the other his masked avatar Spiderman. This is the sixth Spiderman ever since Sam Raimi and Tobey Mcguire took the helm and although it isn't unappealing by any means, the narrative is stale and predictable. In fact, the Peter Parker stuff is far more enjoyable and appealing then the spidey bits. On a 10-star rating this would rate about a 6. Nowhere as good as the original Spiderman but nowhere as bad as the 3rd part and the Andrew Garfield version.

Review_Title: Great fun with a few flaws
Review: 'Spider-Man: Homecoming' is a fun venture into the Marvel adaptation of the character, but it isn't without it's flaws. A few casting choices were baffling, and I don't feel that they delved enough into Peter's character, but this is certainly Spider-Man's best on-screen representation since 2004. With great action, a compelling villain, and the great balance between Peter Parker and Spider-Man, I definitely recommend 'Spider-Man: Homecoming' to Spider-Man fans and casual audiences.

Author: memphisgreene
Review_Title: Too Lighthearted For Its Own Good
Review: A much more lighthearted and to-the-point reboot that doesn't bore us with yet another origin story. The problem is that Spider-Man seemed like the one giant Marvel hero who had more dimensions to him than anyone else because his identity is secret. He's got actual tragedy in his past that he couldn't fire laser beams at. And he's just a kid who had to grow up real fast. By sanding down a lot of the things that made him so relatable, and relegating the Peter Parker side to simply a series of things he's going to have to ditch and then say sorry to is both annoying and frustrating as someone who wants to be given any reason to care at all about the hundredth Marvel movie to be released in 15 years. The fact that the character is also "the acrobatic one" of the heroes means most of the scenes translate to watching animated computer figures bounce around for long stretches, which didn't help either. In the end, it's a totally forgettable flick that's best utilized for a boring afternoon.

Review: Whether you've seen Tobey Maguire and Andrew Garfield's iterations of the Spider-Man character, Tom Holland's performance is sure to blow you away. Action sequences never looked better in a Spider-Man film, and it is surely on-par with the previous SM films.

Author: Agent_Bauer
Review: Worst spider-man ever. I could have posted a bitter 1 star review but that wouldn't have been a true reflection. This was an average movie at best, it had some fun moments but really at the end of it I didn't really feel anything. They are going mental with these reboots, I wonder who will play the next spiderman in 3 years time. This is getting out of hand. I hope everyone simply boycotts the next movies to teach marvel/Sony a lesson.Tobey Maguire's Peter Parker was the best version of the friendly neighbourhood spiderman there was, why fix something that wasn't broken? As for this movie it was far too avengers orientated, introducing new characters, villains and sidekicks. There is no origin story here. Spiderman exists from the start so it continues from where they left of in the captain America movie. Also it seemed pretty clear that they were playing towards some diversity quota with an influx of oriental and black actors. It seemed kind of forced upon us, didn't seem natural as far as the movie goes. They were clearly aiming for the huge Chinese market to get more $$$. Marisa tomei is clearly miscast as aunt may. Holland doesn't fit his role as spiderman well either, he seems more of a pre pubescent version of the superhero. Michael Keaton does well in his villainous role. His character and his cleanup team are forced to sell alien technology weapons in order to make ends meet after being put out of work by clean up teams organised by the government. Spiderman spots them and tries to stop them, succeeds in the end. That's the movie basically. There is some comedy and romance that seemed wooden thrown in. There was no chemistry whatsoever. An average affair.

Author: thezone1
Review_Title: Tony Stark, Spiderman's Father Figure? Really? UGH!
Review: The only reason I gave this 5 stars was because Michael Keaton and Robert Downey Jr. made this move actually worth watching. The forgettable guy that played Spiderman acted like he was 10 years old. And Aunt May? Really? She was more like his sister than Aunt!! What idiot made these decisions. I am sure that Tom Holland and Marisa Tomei are great actors but who ever made them play it like they did needs to get a reality check. Who acts like that in real life? No one I know!!! I have been a Spiderman fan since the 60's. I don't remember him ever acting like a little boy. I cringed every time he interacted with Ironman. It almost made me turn the movie off/walk out of the theater. The only reason you want to watch this movie is because you are a Marvel fan and enjoy Stan Lee's super hero's. Otherwise this movie is a complete waste of time. And sadly, this is the first marvel movie that I would not recommend anyone to watch. Well except for Michael Keaton's performance. But then you can probably find that on youtube!!! NOT RECOMMENDED!

Author: blqdefx
Review_Title: Title: Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017) - A Spectacular Journey of Growth and Responsibility.
Review: The narrative and character development of this is very parallel to the one of Batman Beyond. They both share similar beats; the importance of the person beneath mask, the technological advancements in their retrospective worlds, and delve into the legacy of their predecessors, that being Tony to Peter and Bruce to Terry, both striving for their acceptance, living up to their legend and learning to find their own paths as a hero. Amusing considering Beyond was created in the late 90's to appeal to a teenage audience and be much similar to Spider-Man.

Author: nassanwar
Review: Spider-Man is finally back in the hands of Marvel studios and is now part of the MCU, but is that really a good thing? The Marvel Machine is back with a new superhero flick, Spider-Man: Homecoming the introduction of the beloved hero into this huge franchise already chock full of different kinds of heroes, villains, and characters. But can the character still be as great in a universe where everyone has the same character traits we've known and loved about him? For example, His joking cracking at tense moments, his nerdy and antisocial nature, or his ability to be heroic while still being relatable to the average moviegoer. This was the big question I had going into the film, and I don't think I got the answer I wanted.

Author: arghya-01497
Review_Title: Changes are for good! Are they really?
Review: When a movie is being made with a widely popular, hugely acknowledged character like Spiderman, comparisons have become unavoidable. When films are being made with a character over a considerable period of time, changes are to be made as per the requirements of time. But the basic things are expected to remain the same. With the recent movie, the Marvels studios have made some significant changes. First, be the Spider suit. Well, previously the suits were made by Peter Parker himself. But now it is made by Stark industries. Now the suit is suggesting Parker what to do or what not to. An unacceptable and totally unnecessary change for a spider man lover. He should be spider man because of him, not for the suit. Secondly, the never forgettable acting skills of Toby Maguire. No one really interested what spider man does with the mask because all the stunts are done with stuntman or special effects. Showing the emotions, the frustrations, require really good acting skills and were successfully done by Toby Maguire. We love him because with his acting skills he made us feel that he is one of us. Thirdly, why the first 40 to 45 minutes of the movie is made such a way is beyond any comprehension. Any Spiderman lover would like to leave the hall or turn the channel. It is such a pain to see such bogus, useless, needless comedy that leads to nowhere, for such a long period of time.

Author: ekavalaa
Review_Title: Spider-Man: Homecoming is the best Spidey movie ever made
Review: IT MAY seem ridiculous, rebooting Spider-Man for the third time in 15 years but after seeing Spider-Man: Homecoming, you'll be glad they did. The Tobey Maguire Spider-Man of 2002 was fine; the Andrew Garfield Amazing Spider-Man of 2012 was also fine. The Tom Holland Spider-Man of 2017 is the best Spider-Man movie ever to grace the screen. Spider- Man: Homecoming is the perfect blend of high school dramedy and superhero antics. This is Marvel's homage to John Hughes, complete with Ferris Bueller reference. By taking it back to the school setting and ageing Spidey down to 15 years old, it recaptures some of the innocent magic gleaned in the comic pages. It also, for a movie with a flying villain and an altitude-defying superhero, grounds the story. One of the main criticisms of superhero blockbusters is that they're overblown with ever-increasing, imminent apocalypses and cities toppling over, usually in a stupidly bombastic third act. Here, the stakes are much smaller, as is the body count with Peter turning off his suit's "kill mode" as quickly as he realised it existed. For this Spider-Man, asking a girl to the homecoming dance is as fraught as stopping the bad guy. Our reintroduction to this iteration of Spider-Man starts with a home video Peter shot on his phone of all the behind-the-scenes action of his adventure with the Avengers. It's cheeky, fun and a clever reminder of what a big hit the character was in Captain America: Civil War and how Holland managed to steal every scene he was in from much, much bigger stars. It sets the tone for the whole movie as we join Peter at his science high school where he and his Star Wars-loving friend Ned (Jacob Batalon) aren't the most popular kids in school. Here, Peter has to worry about Spanish quizzes, winning the academic decathlon and keeping his secret identity under wraps from the classmates he saves. In many ways, it has more than a touch of Buffy the Vampire Slayer.

Author: iNathanJagger
Review_Title: The smallest thing could have given it a 10
Review: As I have watched all Marvel movies and will continue to do so leading up to Infinity War, I had high expectations for this movie - especially as SpiderMan 4 was cancelled and The Amazing Spider-Man 3 for stupid reasons but also with stupid plots to come in the movie. So Spiderman: Homecoming was going to be a show stopper for me, and it was! The humour was unimaginably good with perfect timings and getting to know Peter and Ned and the bad guy with all their intentions and lead ups and awkward moments in the movies, with the ending being shocking up understandable. The only downside for me is that we didn't get to know his friends around him, we understood Ned and Liz but everyone else we didn't get to know like I feel like we should of, Michelle we got to know a bit about with her mind and understanding, being the one whose quietly clever and understanding smart with her sarcastic comment, but I would of mind knowing where she got that sense of humour from and what else is her link to Peter and Ned because all we know is she sat alone with no friends on the same Table as then (Happily). Now Flash, he isn't a flash - is a Flash who wants to be mean but doesn't know how to, I feel like was a weak way of putting him in the movie as they didn't know exactly what to do to him and how to make him the meanie we know him to be. We know flash as a bully who picks on Peter the most because he can and has no excuse not to, and Liz as she is the equivalent of Mary - her and Flash have no connection and no relationship, for the time they are together I don't think they spoke to each other, just was in the same conversation but with aiming their talking at each other. It seems like Flash is Flash in the movie is because Peter does what he wants and doesn't give a sh** and Flash is jealous of it and fails to be jealous on the outside and get put down like you think the school bully should but it's a movie - he should be the bully who doesn't get done. Flash was a missed opportunity in this movie and I hope he gets a backbone in the next one and I hope we learn more about his friends/group in the next movie. Now Aunt May Parker, she is the wrong actor to play with character, we know her as an old women who is on the breaking point every day but keeps with the backbone for Peter even when he lets her down, even if The Amazing Spider man was a weak excuse of a Spiderman movie she still did the part - where as this Aunt May was young hurt and seemed like she grew a bit older since Captain America: Civil War. When we saw her they were short and simple lines and at times getting hit on by some guys around, but when she was upset Peter had to say a few words to make the attention go to him crying. I feel like when she was shown it was an easy way of pumping the movie length a bit longer, except Peter crying scene, but that could have been done way better than done. I still to this day will say the original Spider man film with the classic characters and plots was the best one, but this film just shows in part what both Spider Man and The Amazing Spider Man did well, and it shocking as The Amazing Spider Man for me was a waste of money that earned money.

Author: acemi-87004
Review: Superhero movies usually are more or less of the same kind, but this movie takes you on a different ride. Would recommend to my friends and family.

Author: helencatherinetaylor
Review_Title: Great actors, great start, good finish, what happened in the 1.5 hrs between?
Review:
I was really looking forward to this, loved the look of Tom Holland from his appearances in the avenger films so far and from the trailer. Also loved Ned the sidekick, and let's be honest, when does Michael Keaton ever put a foot wrong?
So it started well, but honestly most of the funny/good bits were in the trailer. Then it got boring. I mean really boring.
How did they get this so wrong?
Also big shout out to the wonderful Marissa Tomei, who was as good as she could be as Aunt May but really didn't have enough to work with. Sounds like a sideline comment but Aunt May has always been the big moral compass for Peter in the comics and films past.
Like I say, it ended nicely. But all in all? Meh

Author: brianrorr
Review_Title: Pretty good, but underwhelming after Civil War Introduction
Review: I thought the film was overall fairly good, with some great scenes in between quite a bit of lackluster scenes. It definitely felt very.....high school, which I guess it was going for since Spiderman is a highschooler. The first 15 minutes were downright boring and disappointing, possibly some of the worst intro to a villain and protagonist in Marvel movies yet. But then the film picked up! And when Peter Parker was in the Spiderman suit, the energy was high and humor on point!! I loved Spiderman's quips at the bad guys on the ferry, perfect humor amidst fighting, and what Spiderman would do to make fun of his opponent, keep things light. I loved that.

Author: samgironda
Review: 'Spider-Man Homecoming' takes place after the events of 'Captain America: Civil War' where Peter Parker is finding it difficult to settle back into his normal and everyday routine of attending School and dealing with the many responsibilities of being a teenager. Tom Hollands performance in the film is outstanding. He makes a perfect Spider-Man and easily portrays the comedic and fun loving superhero all Spider-Man fans know and love. Throughout the film we see Peter deal with a lot of different, emotional situations. There is a scene towards the end of the film which really shows the character struggling and not being sure of himself. Tom Hollands acting in these scenes is great and being part of the audience, it allows you to feel that emotion and understand what Peter Parker is dealing with. One of the main concerns that many people had about this film was the involvement of Tony Stark. Many fans were worried about the character stealing the spotlight but it's safe to say that his screen time was distributed perfectly and he was a great asset to the film. Michael Keaton's portrayal as the Vulture was great. His character had motive for what he was doing and wasn't just shoehorned in the film for the sake of it. Michael Keaton is great at portraying such serious and menacing characters and in this film it definitely payed off. The overall story ran very smoothly. All the characters were introduced really well and we continued to learn a little more about them as the film progressed. There were no boring parts in the film or certain scenes that felt like they dragged on for too long. It was great to see a Marvel Studios take on a Spider-Man film and I can't wait to see where this character ends up next.

Author: Luca09
Review: A very nice movie and fun to see how Peter is struggling with being Spider-Man and being at school. A little disappointment is that they animated almost everything of the suit, but apart from that I still love the suit. I really think Tom Holland is perfect for this roll.

Author: sebastblanco
Review: A teen comedy with interesting action scenes. A good villain in the shoes of Michael Keaton. Some characters are unbearable like Flash Thompson and unremarkable performances. It is entertaining but nothing more and so we see how Spidey enters the MCU with his own movie.

Author: junky-90089
Review: One of those movies you have to give time. I struggled in the first half but it really picked up and kept going in the last half.

Author: barfighter
Review: After civil war, and seeing STARK built his suit, and that uncle Ben was just imaginary, and that Disney butchered the character with a high school musical style look, then ridiculed the other important characters, it was apparent to see that this mass produced trash's sequel was not worth anything, I mean come on, Peter distances himself from people, and friends to keep them safe, not puberty. Stupid Disney

Author: cheyennesmith-762-532623
Review: Spiderman: Homecoming was a good movie, but I didn't think it was as much fun as the new Wonder Woman film that I recently watched. Although I'm more fond of Toby Maguire, I would say that Tom Holland is better that Andrew Garfield. I never like Garfield btw. His Spiderman suit also looked good in its cartoonish kind of way. Michael Keaton was a good choice for the Vulture. The Vulture suit was pretty cool and menacing. My only gripe about the Vulture is that he didn't have that much screen time. When the film starts, you get to see him for a couple minutes and about half an later, you get to seen him for another minute, etc. The part where Vulture finds out that Peter is Spiderman is when the action between Spiderman and Vulture actually starts. That's about an hour and a half into the movie. I was rather disappointed with Shocker. They only used him in a couple of brief scenes then quickly gets killed off. Then he quickly gets replaced with another one of Vulture's minions and they only used him for one brief scene. I was never that fond of Shocker, but it felt like a wasted opportunity to introduce him to the big screen. The one character I just did not like when Peter's classmate Michelle. She is the most unlikable character ever. Even more so than Flash Thompson. Every time you see her, she always makes some smart ass remark to Peter or his friend Ned. When you see her at Lizzie's party, she flips a bird at Peter when he first shows up. When Peter is in detention, she shows him a sketch she made of him being miserable with a cold look on her face. I the movie but I wouldn't call it outstanding. Out of all the movies that they made up till now. I would say homecoming is better than the Andrew Garfield movies, Spiderman 3, and underneath Spiderman and Spiderman 2.

Author: zoatrobe
Review_Title: Enjoyed this movie, but they bungled Peter's character so much...
Review: First of all, I love Tom Holland. Tobey Maguire was a good Peter and Andrew was a good Spider-Man. Tom Holland is perfect at both.

Author: oscarertman
Review_Title: A high-school Age Spiderman Cruises around the city,and hopes for something big to do.
Review: I really liked this movie.The only thing I do not like is the new suit.It just bothers me for some unknown reason.I also just generally do not love superhero movies(the only exception being Deadpool).Personally,I would recommend it.It's a pretty good movie. I enjoy everything,and I like seeing the struggle about becoming independent.The other criticism is that the second after-credit scene was a troll.but it was still funny.so I guess It's okay.

Author: codfather-84460
Review: Going into the cinema to watch the latest Spider-Man movie, I prevented myself from worrying by remembering the good ol' days of Spider-Man movies with the first two Raimi Spidey flicks and while I wasn't totally taken back to those days, I was certainly satisfied. As a fan of the MCU, I did care a lot to see this movie and as being a fan of Spider-Man since my early years gave me a personal connection which was probably my biggest draw towards this movie. While the movie's not flawless, there's more to love than hate for sure.

Author: huberthh
Review: Got to say this is the best Marvel movie for teens. And only if you are teens.

Author: tster-40094
Review_Title: One of the best Marvel Cinematic Universe movies.
Review: To be honest I'm not a huge marvel fan or even a huge Spiderman fan, but I still really love this movie. I think the main reason for this is the characters. Tom Holland is absolutely amazing as Spiderman and his struggle in the movie of having to balance the challenges of being a teenager with being a superhero is really interesting and compelling. As a teenager myself, I like that the kids in this movie actually act like teenagers and their interactions are really funny and genuine. This movie also has a really good villain, especially for the MCU, played by Michael Keaton, who is intimidating and has understandable motivations. The script for this movie is also very strong and has some really funny jokes and good character moments. If there are flaws to this movie it's that the action is pretty bland and underwhelming, but it's not necessarily bad and is still enjoyable to watch. Overall, I really love this movie and would recommend it even to people who don't really care about Marvel movies.

Author: guccimershad
Review: I just want to say this movie is fantastic. I like this amount of comedy in the movie. The Spider-Man character in this series of films is better than the previous ones and gives a more cheerful feeling.

Author: balatino
Review: In general in dont watch to many marvel movies. However, after a long time of absence I gave this one a Go.. And it was a very good choice. Very easy and nice to watch and really a great comedy. This is good time cinema.

Author: spidermanrocks-61457
Review_Title: The best depiction of Spider Man since the 2000's Spider Man movie.
Review: While it may not be perfect, this movie, almost, has the best depiction of a teenage Peter Parker. The comedy is hilarious, the action is perfect, it's one of the greatest movies of 2017! Although, there may be a few flaws, like, they didn't add more. I mean, even a cameo of Venom could've helped, but I guess we can't expect everything from this movie. Short and simple: it's the most accurate depiction of Spider Man in his teenage years. Also, side note: I don't know what in the hell the people reviewing this movie as bad are yapping on about, this movie is perfect to a true Spider Man fan.

Author: rippetoe18
Review_Title: One of the strongest MCU and Spider-Man films
Review: To me, the MCU has been floundering since Winter Soldier and Guardians of the Galaxy. Civil War was good, but very overrated, Guardians 2 was just good, and Ant-Man was just okay. This movies broke the so-so streak and delivered a fun, funny, and interesting take on the character of Spider-Man.

Author: alexpaintercanada
Review_Title: Entertaining, fun, and just what you want from this sort of movie.
Review: The story? It's a superhero film - it's simple. You can turn your brain off for 133 minutes and just enjoy. Don't expect the best film ever, but my lord, this film makes me happy.

Author: greloy
Review: In this times of superheroe wave, homecoming has everything to be an antihero movie. The best spidey till now

Author: ethanmaly
Review_Title: Pretty much on par with the amazing spiderman movies
Review: This was boring, generic and unfunny. Almost nothing happened in more than two hours, the side characters were boring, Tom Holland is an annoying Spiderman and the stakes were so small compared to other marvel movies.

Author: w-76069
Review:
A very good spider man storyFinally,
we saw a high school version of spider man
He showed the story of spider man
Want to do bigger things from the beginningLater,
I recognized my ability and decided to be down-to-earth
This is the growth of a teenager
From the beginning, the dependence on battle clothesLater, he defeated the vultures completely on his own

Author: markussign
Review_Title: Closest to the comic books, great spider man movie
Review: This movie is whtout a doubt the closest you come to the comic books. You have a villian that is actually a normal human and with real motives to hate his enemies. Spiderman have to learn everything from the beginning.

Author: sunny_bij
Review: Wasn't sure about this entry after the trailers, but am happy with the outcome. The Good : Tom Holland as Peter Parker/Spider-man is an absolute treat to watch. Don't think it's fair comparing his take to Tobey's or Andrew's version of the character as the universe it is set in is totally different. I do believe that all 3 actors did justice to the material that was given to them. Bearing that in mind...the material for this one was 'Good Old Fashioned Fun'so there was very little about it not to like. Michael Keaton as The Vulture...Loved every bit of it! The motivations for his villainy (though cliché'd) come out beautifully with his performance. Driven and unpredictable...I mean, what more could you ask for? If I watched this film for a 2nd time, it would be for Michael Keaton's Vulture! Now, The Not So Good : This isn't really the movie's fault, but nothing Spider-man does on film has the VOW effect on me anymore! Seeing the action in Spider- man (2002) particularly the sequence right before the end titles left me blown away and wanting more. I guess there have just been too many action sequences over the course of 7 films (and 3 franchises now) that they just come across as "Been there, Done That!" I am taking into account that I'm 38 years old today as opposed to 23 when the first film came out (and 5 when I saw Nicholas Hammond in the TV show) so that probably has a lot to do with my sentiment, and I probably sound stupid complaining about a movie about a guy who swings and climbs for a living when he actually swings and climbs, but maybe the filmmakers need to find a way to make the action look fresher and less generic in comparison to the previous entries. That being said...still enjoyed it to a degree The Bad - (or what I didn't like) The High Tech Suit : I tried to like it, even bearing in mind that this a next gen Spidey set in a world with Alien Invasions and whatnot, but it was lost on me! There was a point in the movie where I felt Peter didn't need his inherent Spidey Powers because the suit seemed to be doing all the work. Betty Brant could have been in that suit and it would have done something. What I love most about Peter Parker in the comics is his limited resources yet genius intellect which brings me to my second point :- From whatever angle you look at it, Shared Universe or not - Avenger or not, Spider-man is the Crown Jewel of the Marvel Universe. It does not feel good as a fan to see him upstaged in his own film! All due respect to Marvel and what they've done with Robert Downey Jr as Iron Man, but the whole mentor thing took away a bit of zing from the experience. If I remember correctly, there is an arc in the comic where Peter Parker hacks in to the Stark Industries main frame thereby getting recruited as an Avenger, not the other way round where he is chasing them like a lost lamb. Sigh of relief when Peter declines the offer in the end! Still....A Enjoyable Experience where the Good very much outweighs the Bad. Look forward to a lot more Spidey (stand alone) with a little less Avenger!

Author: j_paija
Review: I am not a fan of these modern action movies, where scenes and angles are cut fast. The pace is rather fast throughout the film, resembling those 3d-animations with lots of yelling and rollercoast-like screenplay. At the same time, the backround music is mostly traditional pompous orchestra. It was nice to hear a punk song a couple of times, but all in all the traditional action movie music does not fit this ADHD movie.

Author: drag_devilchad
Review: Please don't expect too much for this movie. I tried not to watch the last trailer. Because too much spoiler in the first trailer. And when I watched this movie, little disappointment seems to appear.

Author: liamhellewellclews
Review: Overall, I really liked this version of Spider-Man. As an adult, I found it to be a little bit childish, particular the opening 30 minutes, or so. The plot was a refreshing take on the typical superhero movie, as the evolution of the criminal was really emphasized. I liked the geeky humour and the younger Spider-man. I absolutely loved Aunt May 2.0 who I found to be endearing and to have a closer relationship with Peter.

Author: shelbywaltman
Review: First off I want to say that I will give this film a 7/10 because I do not want anyone to think that it is an absolutely horrible film. My main issue with this film is the suit!!!! Spiderman does not need all of the tech that Iron Man needs etc. I am so angry with the writers for basically taking away what Spiderman is, he does not need all of this high tech to be Spiderman. The basic story behind Spiderman is that he is a kid in a suit and that his powers are enough to make him Amazing(kind of where the whole "Amazing Spiderman" thing comes into play). I do not want to step all over this film because it happens to be a decent film. It could have been an absolutely amazing film if they were to 1) Get rid of the unnecessary technology suit. 2) Do not let Tony Stark control Peter like he is a little kid. Just because he is young does not mean he can't hold his own.

Author: joelsave
Review_Title: Best stand alone marvel movie since iron man 1!
Review: This movie had everything a good superhero movie needs. Action, humor and a fantastic lead role. Tom Holland is easily the best spider-man yet but I cant say Toby was bad either. Tom Hollands performance was extraordinary both is spider-man but also as the high school kid Peter Parker. RDJ also did a good job as a mentor for Peter which helped the story to continue forward and also made the story feel relate-able and real for the viewers. It's hard to forget how good the supporting teenagers in the film were. Jacob Bolton did a good job as Peters nerdy friend Ned and Zendaya as Peters crush. These characters made the Tom as Peter a much more complete character. This is what I loved about the movie.

Author: ishitalaw
Review: This is a movie, you'd love to go and watch with your family specially if there are kids in the house. After all, Superheroes fascinate us all. The movie goes on smoothly and does not really have any nail biting intense action scenes that are expected out of a Marvel movie, but overall it's worth a watch. Iron man's charisma is a cherry on top.

Author: jmorris-30022
Review: Before stepping foot into the theater to watch this film, I was a bit skeptical, to say the least. I'm not a fan of superhero movies, however, from the very first opening credit, I knew that this would be a spectacular extravaganza. The cinematography and effects are phenomenal, but what makes this film is the surprisingly original take on a very overused blockbuster story. Every character is its own, completely set apart from the other spider-man films, and every actor executes their role flawlessly. I was so happy to find that the characters actually looked like actual high-schoolers, and apart from the hair-raising action, it was a wonderfully crafted teenage comedy and portrayed a relatable story with a diverse array of characters. I particularly enjoyed Zendaya's and Martin Starr's characters and felt they played their roles with perfect comedic timing. I highly recommend this film.

Author: yykjugtj
Review: Pretty good! it's can connect to avenges, iron man 1 , captain of America and them history

Author: Lauerjb4
Review_Title: All and all a great movie
Review: This is one of the best movies I have ever seen. There isn't a single part about it I didn't like. At first i didn't really want to watch it, but i did anyways because I was bored, and now i am really glad I did. If you haven't seen it yet then go see it! You won't regret it.

Author: christopherjune
Review: If there was ever a movie to sum up this current generation of kids its this one.. whiney and think they are owed something.

Author: penguinopolipitese
Review_Title: I feel like this could've just been an episode of Agents of SHIELD
Review:
If I could I'd give this something in the high 6's. It's entertaining but I sort of felt like I walked in half way through the movie and had missed something... we just jumped straight in with little explanation of why things were happening. Because of this I'm still not 100% on if spiderman actually has powers anymore but it seems not. From what I could see, this movie is sort of like Iron Man goes to high school. There's a suit, there's a non-threatening ai who helps the user of the suit. But what makes spiderman special exactly? Tony Stark may not have super powers but at least he has the intelligence to make the damn iron man suit. I guess it brings up another avenue of story telling when he's given his power by another person but it just doesn't have the same gravity to me because this is something that can be easily taken away and then you're left asking why couldn't it be anyone in that suit. Maybe they were just sick of telling the same story for the 3rd time. I had a similar feeling when the newest hulk showed up in avengers. It's just like: we need a warm body to play this role so lets just slip him in and hope people accept it and we can make some more movies. It's great to have the fuller embodiment of that universe but at the same time I feel like I've been to this puppet show and it was better done before.
This movie felt like it shouldn't have been a full fledged movie.

Author: nishantvarma
Review_Title: Good Movie, but not a good "Spiderman" movie!
Review: It's a good watch, if you aren't much into comics and the shows you will definitely enjoy the movie to some extent but if you really know who Spidey is then you will HATE most parts of the movie. First of all Spiderman never really relied on tech, In SMH we see peter doing all those great things because of his suit, the suit literally tells him what to do, when to sit when to talk and when to kiss like really! This isn't an iron man movie, I know times are changing and everything's gotta adapt that way but whoa really? You might as well give him an iron man suit while you're at it. Spiderman purely relied on his own abilities, we have seen him fight with his suit ripped to shreds and THAT makes him awesome. The Spidey sense is GONE! That's like Thor without his hammer. Also the driving force of what makes spiderman "Spiderman" is uncle Ben, his vision to be a man like him in his own way, not some wannabe superhero trying to impress Iron man. Also spiderman is not DUMB he can hack his own suit, look through enemy's strategy and stuff with ease as opposed to in the movie. The cast was horrible, Flash is an average Indian dude playing quiz with the 5-6 people we see, he's pretty likable which is NOT supposed to happen with flash, Spidey's best friend is a fat Asian, the girl calling herself MJ is not really relevant until she calls herself that, the movie tries hard to stuff diversity in our faces, nothing wrong at all with this cast IF you are making any other movie but if you're gonna cast a black dude for superman or a white dude for black panther or cyborg then you're doing it wrong mate! The movie has some really bad logic, like the chitauri core doesn't seem harmful until the suit tells peter it's harmful, it's understandable after the x-ray machine but even before that it starts to act weird when it was pretty harmless all the time peter held it everywhere. The Washington monument is damaged and no one gives a f*ck why it happened no investigation nothing, if that happened the fat harry and peter would've been in custody for pretty long. Also the core which was starting to turn into a small sun, burning sheets and making the bag glow doesn't harm fat harry at all! The ship gets sliced into half with lasers shooting everywhere and no one even gets injured! What happened to green goblin throwing balls and vaporizing people into skeletons?

Author: lmafreak
Review: Well, I always loved the Sam Raimi trilogy and hated the Amazing Spider-man. But this one is a very good one. It is a really funny teenage movie, filled with young people and jokes. The bad guy is not that bad after all, and it is funny to see a young avenger ascending to success.

Author: theboredmen
Review: Spiderman is a great movie from the past. I remember it since I was 6 years old. So I was very keen how Spiderman movie would look like in the 2017.

Author: alfredosei
Review:
Worst spidey movie ever..
But guess they don't care about our opinions other than getting our money..

Author: minigonche
Review: Very watchable movie. Loved the whole unsuccessful love story with Liz and how you grow found of MJ without knowing it's her. Nice transformation of Peter's character and love the new take on aunt may.

Author: madbox-36552
Review: Looks like this is supposed to be the movie Spider-Man: Homecoming. But for some reason it's labelled as Spider-Man: Far From Home Extended Cut

Author: alenabozic
Review: I went into this movie expecting next to nothing and somehow I was still disappointed. Incredibly long, at the 40 minute mark I thought to myself "the movie could have started here and it would be exactly the same". Pointless scenes. No emotional core. All the characters were one dimensional and at times irritating. Bland plot even for a Marvel movie. I thought the villain was just a henchman and wondered who the villain would be revealed as until near the end of the movie. Romance was pointless. No chemistry between anyone or anything. One of the most boring and pointless movies I have seen in a very long time. Feels like whoever wrote it did so in a day or two, with as much passion as one would put into a mandatory school assignment.

Author: davidmichz
Review_Title: Great film, really lives up to expectations!
Review: What can I say? I walked into this film with high hopes as I was really excited to see what Jon Watts was able to do behind the camera on such a big budget film, he didn't disappoint!

Author: filmerflick
Review_Title: Fun energetic feel good movie, that gives us the Spider-Man we have been craving!
Review: Spider-Man Homecoming tells the coming of age tale Peter Parker as he struggles to balance school, family, and being a superhero and that's what it should be. This film brings Spider-Man back to his charm as what made Spidey so relatable was that he was not a larger than life superhero but one of us. Tom Holland does a phenomenal job portraying Peter Parker/ Spider-Man with his youthful charm, and infectious charisma, as does everybody else. One stand out in particular being Michael Keaton as the Vulture. Having significantly more depth than your standard MCU villain Michael Keaton delivers a joyfully over the top performance with a surprising amount of depth. However although this film does have a lot to love about there are still many flaws that may make it a disappointment for some viewers, one big one being that the film has no weight to it. Everything from the emotion to the action feels without any stakes and frankly just underwhelming. Where as every Spider-Man movie from this point had pretty exceptional action scenes (including The Amazing Spider-Man 2) this one included several jump cuts and no impact. There are also a few minor issues with the film, without getting into spoiler territory there was one scene in particular that was very clearly an advertisement for an Audi. Overall although I would still say Sam Raimi's Spider-Man 1 and 2 are still better this is undeniably a very fun enjoyable summer flick. As far as Marvel movies go I'd say this one's pretty great. And I'm giving this one a 7 or 8/10.

Author: robertoruiz-96486
Review: "Spider-Man: Homecoming": One-Sentence Review

Author: a-59721
Review:
My expectations were low going in. I wasn't as fan of the Raimi installments but was warming up to the Amazing Spiderman movies that were discontinued. A real shame as in those we actually got the spiderman in suit as portrayed in the comics. And more importantly; not so much a nerdy but a more smart-ass Peter Parker. So now there is this movie. So how was it? Pretty decent and fun actually!
Peter here is a young kid grounded in this modern day and age. The movie plays more like a teen coming-of-age movie than let's say the latest Marvel Avengers entry. We see high school (prom) insecurities being played up, a wing man for comic relief, being unpopular while having a crush an the popular girl of the class. Actually it's nicely done; just tip toing between cliché while keeping it fresh. The cultural diversity was also good.
The acting is top notch. Holland plays it pretty straight as a quirky hyper kid full of ambitions. The jokes land just right, most of the time. I do feel Keaton was severely underused in the movie, but hey he is the villain. 
How's that saying again in another superhero flick? Not the Spiderman we want, but the one we deserve.

Author: wiggomikaeloqvist
Review: What can I say? Tom Holland was born ready to play as spider Man. The movie has a lot of good jokes and the storyline is awesome! I definitely recommend this movie.

Author: naconaekaliateca
Review: It's a decent movie,but there was way too much fluff. Most of the supporting cast and recurring characters feel superfluous to the main plot. Peter gains almost nothing relating or building to the main lesson of the movie from anyone outside of Iron man and the Vulture. Condensed, Homecoming would be an epic thirty minute short. As a full movie, it struggles to be good.

Author: hurricane-san
Review: The movie is absolutely ridiculous, most of the time.

Author: cliffordadamsii
Review: My son left the room before this began playing, and evidently had more spider sense than the main character (and given evidently Iron Man had to make a special suit for Spidey to have the capability, I'm even more right). Didn't understand the need for the PG13 rating material (the utterance of "Asshole" in the early minutes seemed unnecessarily dark, and that darkness failed to really carry forward which would have targeted the movie to a certain demographic. They could have kept it PG-safe, but as the rest of the movie played out, I realized the identity crisis this movie has.

Author: ambarishadak-105
Review_Title: A lot more than I think
Review: I hope it is a good film but I didnt think this this much good. Actually to my opinion this is greater than far from home. I like his costume and he is really like a teenager. I like Tom Holland acting in this film. I really recommending this and this is in my favourite movie list.

Author: jjarv-79079
Review: This MCU reboot of Spider Man certainly kicks off the new trilogy with balanced action, enjoyable comedy and well thought out characters. Tom Holland definitely achieves the role of both Peter Parker and Spider Man and surprised me when I first watched it. Although a little less grand and a little more low key compared to other Marvel Movies, Homecoming does extremely well in introducing the characters, setting up the new universe and jumping straight into action with the new villain. I can't say it is a classic, or a masterpiece - but that is expected with a film designed to introduce and ease into a new trilogy. Overall, it is a great movie that definitely deserves attention and a high place in MCU movie ranks.

Author: karsonstark
Review: Good movie good actor's , I agree that there isn't a scene that rivals the train scene in Spiderman 2, but the moment when he's buried under the rubble and screaming for help was really touching. And I liked the down time, the moments of Peter just being Peter.

Author: Nolabrams
Review_Title: A fun one timer popcorn event with more Spider-Man magic
Review: A more immature version of the famous superhero, that is an enjoyable ride of self-discovery, adulthood and classic "save the day" action. The film takes several small and teeny steps, one at a time to develop the plot -- but it ultimately works as a standard story of great, but meager originality to its main premise. Twists and fun action are big pluses, but fragments of anticlimactic humor and poor character development are forcefully pushing the film down. But in the end it still serves as a fun one timer popcorn event, and that successfully restores the magic to the character that 'The Amazing Spiderman'- franchise totally ruined.

Author: darooriraghava298
Review: This is hands down the best incarnation of Spider-Man on the big screen we had since 2004 Spider-Man 2. And, also this is a really well made movie with great action sequences and humor with balancing story and characters that you care about even though you know nothing about them. And, speaking of new characters, this movie has some new characters that we haven't seen on big screen in any Spidey movie yet, but don't worry you will love them leaving this movie. Tom Holland is fantastic as Spider-Man and Peter Parker, more so as Spider-Man than he is as Peter. And of-course, Michael Keaton as The Vulture, perfect! Overall, this is a really good movie with good performances, great action sequences, an interesting back story to a villain we have got in any Spider-Man movie, good characters and a convincing attempt on SONY's point!

Author: kartoffelenvmt
Review: As a teenager watching this film, it was kind of surreal. I know that the demographic for this movie was within my age group, and generally the consensus on this film was that it was good. Personally, I didn't like the film, because I think it lacked something. I understand that this was just meant to be a fun film, with no consequences, but I think the emotional depth that could've been developed I little bit more. For example, I got a bit frustrated when Peter's friend automatically forgave him after he ditched him at a party, a place he was obviously not comfortable with. I would've liked to see a little bit of conflict in that area. I appreciate the school setting, as I understand that that's what fans have been asking for for a long time, but sometimes it just felt like a drag and that it was prolonging the movie. A lot of parts could've been cut out. The comedic aspect of the film hit the mark in some places, like when he dropped the death star Lego set after seeing peter, shock horror. Other jokes were a little bit...eh. Like the porn joke, but I digress, jokes are jokes and are meant to be laughed at and not criticized. In all honesty, I would recommend this to my ~teenage~ friends because it is a solid movie for teenagers.

Author: kajjanaa
Review_Title: Spider-Man: Homecoming truly brings out the "Your friendly neighborhood Spider-Man."
Review: I absolutely loved this movie. It brought in a new element to marvel, Spider-Man was a boy protecting the city, he was a local hero. He was innocent and kind even to his enemies, as demonstrated in the movie on several occasions. He wasn't nearly as powerful as the other Avengers, nor his villains. This is what I love about Spider-Man Homecoming. Spider-Man is local, and saves the city from smaller scale villains. Spider-Man in this film is a scaled down version of the world saving Avengers. And I hope to see more films like this in the future.

Author: its_always_sunny_in_dublin
Review_Title: 'Adds some much needed heart to the MCU'
Review: First of all, this is not the 3rd reboot in 15 years, so don't let that put you off. You're brought into the story after the conventional character turning point of how they got their powers and the tragedy that causes them to don a suit and fight crime that you normally get in a first solo outing.

Review:
The film started very strong but ended very sad, in my opinion.
It ended kind of rough without any further details of the upcoming films of the Marvel Series. I am watching the complete Marvel Series in the chronological order until the Black Widow film coming out this 29th April. I didn't say that I completely didn't enjoyed the movie, but I only didn't like the end. It ended like: "He captured a bandit and he's been assigned to be an Avenger, but he didn't want to" So that's why I didn't like the end. But I enjoyed the movie yet.

Author: kitpanthers
Review_Title: One of the better spider-man films
Review: Had great action and adapted spider-man very well into the MCU. Tom Holland was quite kiddish compared to the previous Spider-Man's but overall he did a good job with his co-star RDJ!

Author: ameenaahmed
Review_Title: Tom Holland's Spider-Man Homecoming brings the whole house down.The best spidey ever.
Review: While going for the movie, I had my reservations with regard to the content after all there has been 4 before this. Whether it would be the same mundane Spidey web slinging of roofs that we've got used to now. But I was baffled by the cool, funny twist that felt so fresh. The portrayal of spider-man is so real,and for instance its actually a teenager and looks and feels like one, a fresh take from the previous version. Ah and who can miss Tony Stark(Downey Jr.) he fills the screen and is in top of his game as usual, this time stepping into the shoes of a mentor. Aunt May(Marisa Tomei) and Vulture too bring out the best performances that grips you. The movie deals with all the aspects of being a teenager in high school. The director Jon Watts has done a great job, the special effect are up to the usual standards of Marvel but the writing which brims with humour just takes it into the next level.

Author: harveycole-54806
Review_Title: As average as a marvel movie get but better
Review: This movie tries to be the standard teenage comedy movie mixed with a standard the marvel movie. It tries to do both and it kinda worked however I wouldnt say it's the best the MCU has made but it's better than the film that came before.

Author: tawe4
Review: First of all, this was a good movie. Tom Holland did a great job of playing a younger Spider-Man. He played the young Peter Parker who has a crush on a pretty young girl Liz (Laura Harrier) and has a hard time talking to her. Michal Keaton did a great job as the vulture, even though it was different than the comic book version. Jacob Batalon as Ned was great and funny. Marisa Tomei did a great job playing a younger version of Aunt May (Even if no One called her Aunt May). Zendaya played the role of Michelle very good and she add some much needed dry humor into the movie. Overall, the cast did great job in there roles. Now, here is the down side. I am a traditional comic book fan. I'm not into this whole social justice garbage that movies and T.V. are pushing on everyone. Tony Revolori who played Flash did do an good version of the character, but Flash is supposed to be an athlete/jock and not a smart kid. I know that times have changed but when it comes to being bullied by someone that is smaller than the main character...well, that's not believable at all. He did a good job for the character they wrote for him but it was so annoying that he was picking on someone who was bigger than him, it didn't make sense. Now, the red button topic, Zendaya possibly playing Mary Jane Watson. I read several articles that said she wasn't playing Mary Jane Watson and Zendaya even said that she wasn't playing the iconic role of Mary Jane Watson (MJ). I don't know if Marvel can't use Mary Jane Watson character or they are just going to do an alternate version of her. I wouldn't be too fond of them from changing Mary Jane Watson from her original correct version of (yes I am going to say it, brace yourself) Red Head White girl instead of being a social justice warrior to change the race of an iconic character to a (brace yourself) black girl. I know I will get the SJW calling me a racist and that I don't know comics. I'm not a racist, I do know my comics, & I don't care what you think. If you get this far, here is what I think Marvel & Sony will be doing. I think they are setting up a Miles Morales story line. Now that would be great. Miles Morales needs to be brought into the MCU and I really think that this version of Spider-Man will be leading to it. Anyway, it was good movie & I believe most people enjoyed it. I did like it (Would have loved for Sony to finish the 3rd Amazing Spider-Man).

Author: viktoriya-21731
Review: In principle, it is clear that this film was made for a teenage audience. Here, the heroes were rejuvenated (compared to Maguire and Garfield, Holland is a kid at all), and the humor became very teenage. I have watched, and more than once, all versions of films about the super hero spider-Man. From my point of view, this version is the most successful. Firstly, the special effects are at an overhanging level, the costumes are also very cool. I want to note that Tom Holland was ideally suited for this role, if we take into account the previous parts, then in the first, the spider was very snotty, in the second reboot of the film, on the contrary, very "twitchy". Here, for me, everything is right to the point!

Author: aazagaynov
Review: Another reboot?! After three Toby Maguire fronted films (two of which I thought were great) and two with Andrew Garfield (that were OK, nothing special) in the lead it seemed very odd that Marvel would reboot the franchise yet again.

Author: perkov-91784
Review: After Avengers Endgame, I thought nothing could surprise me anymore, but as it turned out, I was wrong, because the third part of Spider-Man, No Way Home, came out. And this film really managed to surprise, I bet that this has never happened in Marvel, and indeed in the history of cinema. This is a kind of culmination of everything that we knew about Spider-Man, I think this picture managed to surpass even the original source, namely comics, in which there are more plot twists and crossovers than anywhere else, we can say we have been going to this for 19 years and finally got it which was unimaginable.

Author: robertpetrelli
Review: Tom Holland delivers an excellent performance as Spider-Man in his first solo MCU film. Peter trying to find his way in the world with his spider powers, makes for an excellent story.

Author: crimsondeathgaming
Review_Title: The Best Spider-Man film since, well, since ever!
Review: Going into the cinema, I was worried that it was going to be another Spider-Man origin story- it pleasantly surprised me- in fact it was more of a film about a young boy who has a crush on a girl and who goes to a high school, but- on the side- he is Spider-Man. Tom Holland takes on the role from Andrew Garfield, who took on the role from Tobey Maguire, neither of whom were particularly believable Spideys, as they were way too old to be a fourteen year old, but Tom Holland is a believable Peter Parker. You could believe that he was a fourteen year old. He tackled the role fantastically- despite his accent being British- he did the American voice very believably. He also did his own stunts something that many of Hollywood's A List actors are too afraid to do in current times. Another fantastic performance was from Zendaya, when I watched the film I presumed that Ned was meant to be the comic relief, but, for me and the other people in the cinema she was, with her quotes on her having no friends, drawing people in misery and how the Washington Monument was built by slaves- this comment is laughed off by her decalathon teacher who looked toward a guard of the monument, who did pull a face which meant "She is right!". The guy who brought together the plot was Michael Keaton, some people hailed his performance in this film, whereas I came out of the cinema thinking it was very average- it was not a villain that I would remember like Loki, Red Skull or Ultron. Although I did think that the twist in which Peter went to the door to pick up Liz and the man who answered was Michael Keaton, Liz's father was very good. I liked the touch with Captain America being the PE teacher's back up for a teacher, the PE Teacher made the nice touch of saying that "I think he is a war criminal", also the end credit scene got a giggle- I am not sure it was worth the ten minute wait. In reflection, It was a good film, the best Marvel flick since Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 1, it had it's flaws, the fight scenes were too long and there should have been more of Donald Glover, the could've tied him in with the whole of the rest of the MCU- I was disappointed, also I liked Happy in other films- but I found him annoying in this film- he wasn't the usual Happy. Thank you for reading this review. What did you think of Spider-Man Homecoming? That is what I thought- Thank you!

Author: baranovfed
Review: This mite be one of my favorite spiderman movies and mcu movies. What I love about this movie is how it is like a small story and it full use's it to it's advantage with the small seats and areas of queens and feels like a breath of fresh for spiderman after Andrews run and Tobey's run of the character. I like how they really just made a new spiderman by using some stuff from Miles Morales that works so well with Tom's. And I am glade to see Peter Parker that looks like a teen, Tobey looked like he was 20 in his first film but after that when he was an adult it was fine then, Andrew where he was 20 and looked to cool to be a geek like Peter, wear Tom has that middle ground were he looks a bite younger not 15 maybe 17 but his voice and acting and the writing really seals you on Tom's Peter being younger and more believable. That other cast is pretty great too they have a nice dynamic with Peter that feels how people would act in a high school or even middle school. The villain Vulture is great one of my favorite mcu and spiderman villains because he not a villain who wants to destroy the world, no he is an average guy who wants to help his family and he cares about them too. I like the acting all around Tom like I said really makes you believe that he is young inexperience and looks out for the little guy Ned his friend is a good side character for Peter to bonce off of you feel that they are friends and don't have a lot other once's too, and that there geeks that don't get bullied but get picked on, and I like how Tony gets a little bite of screen time and is like a father figure to Peter and makes Peter want to make Tony proud of him. Overall this is a really great movie and I really recommend you watch it, I give it and 10 out of 10 and a 5 out of 5.

Author: CriticalPete
Review: For years, I had to hear from friends that the Tobey Maguire Spider-Man was a worthy movie. It is not - not compared to the X-Men or Iron-Man franchises. Not compared to Captain America or the Avengers. It's a mediocre film and under the wing of Paramount... and the development execs weren't so great.

Author: lewbn-48105
Review: Spider-Man: Homecoming is an awesome movie and one of the most unique Spider-Man movies we had at the time. It finally moved passed they typical origin story that audiences had already seen multiple times and inserted the character into a much more vibrant/engaging world. The movie also had a nice growth arc for Spider-Man, who began the film being immature and only wanting to become an Avenger to a neighbor hero that wants to focus on "the little guy" and just keep his area safe. A Spider-Man that now has a bigger understanding of the meaning of sacrifice, responsibility, and Selflessness. Plus, Tom Holland was the perfect for this role and reallt helps bring everything together.

Author: kuhnj-19909
Review: Overall, I quite enjoyed this movie. That said, I have to wonder if anyone on the crew did more than a hint of research when drafting the lab procedure to make web fluid. You'd think they'd at least be sure all the compounds they drew on the page were at least plausible, however 1-isopropylene-2-methylcyclohexane is pretty far from that. Beyond which, it seems no one bothered to figure out what actual spider silk was made of, as the lab formula has absolutely nothing capable of creating amino acids (the main component of most spider silks). Unfortunately, this movie, while attempting to feature a science whiz, completely fails to present well-researched science.

Author: jandy1974
Review: Many will say Marvel have hit the mark once again and in some ways they have. This movie most likely will appeal to many and especially to the younger Marvel universe fans. Unfortunately for myself I just found Mark Holland's Spider-Man annoying, which was a disappointment because he nailed Spider-Man in the Avengers. Too be fair Mark's acting has little to do with the character being annoying. I guess I found Spider-Man's witty banter to miss the mark and the way Jon Watts chose to film the movie from the view of a mobile phone, fell flat for me. Still an ok movie it has a solid storyline and some greats action scenes, Robert Downey Jr is great as Tony Stark yet again but I think for my liking Mark Holland's Spiderman really needs the whole team behind him to make his witty remarks work other wise it just becomes too much. As a stand alone character he is one of my least favourite Spider-Mans. Sorry

Author: nh-68611
Review_Title: *SPOILER REVIEW* The morning after viewing the film.
Review: Overall, I really did enjoy the film, getting it right off of my chest – The orchestrated Spider-Man theme at the beginning was epic! I had a huge smile on my face as it took me back to my childhood of watching the cartoon and got me in great mood before the film got started.

Author: moonriverwaltzing
Review: It is well made and shot! All the action scenes were gripping, especially the elevator scene. I like how Peter Parker is portrayed as an excited, bubbly dorkish character but I remember he's a total genius too (which he isn't in the movie?). Great side character choices though. The major hole in the movie (and what I had been really looking forward to watching) is his origin story. How he was bitten, how he adjusted to his powers, etc. People might say they've seen that already, and I understand their point of view, but for me, the way he became Spiderman is the most important part of his story. Also, he's more dependent on gadgets? His suit was damn cool! I totally enjoyed his mishaps with his suit and I would love to see more of it too. But I was expecting something that would give him that edge...traits and powers that are unique to Spiderman. His body was changed by a spider bite but he got only super-strength and that's kinda plain. Other than that, it's a fun watch.

Author: grarestephane
Review: Spider-Man: Homecoming or Spider-Man: The Homecoming in Quebec is an American superhero film directed by Jon Watts, released in 2017. Produced by Marvel Studios and Columbia Pictures, it is distributed by Sony Pictures Entertainment. This is the sixteenth film of the universe Marvel and the fourth in Phase 3. For my part, this is a version too, an extra version of Spider-Man. I love this character, but in a few years we had our lot. The actor has signed for 5 films. Civil War, Homecoming, Avengers 3 and 4 and Homecoming 2 (but still not for Homecoming 3). I hope that we will not have yet another version of Spider-Man in the years to come ...
